review.title: Quiet hotel - high walkability downtown
review.reviewText: Stayed for 3 nights and it was very quiet and comfortable. Located right by Chinatown and down the street from the financial district, it has great walkability to key sights and amenities. Area seemed safe at night, they offered in and out valet parking for a daily fee. The rooms were comfortable. It's an older hotel but kept clean. I would definitely stay again.
Hotel was excellent, staff was friendly and helpful. It was our anniversary and they put out candies and a congratulatory note on our bed in advance.
Great service from very helpful staff! Very close to Union Square and shopping areas.

review.title: Orchard Garden Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a very good choice for a brief San Francisco visit. Howover, by design, it lacks a full restaurant with bar and even lacks a toiletires and snacks options.However, the people are fantastic and the hotel is clean and comfortable and in a greaty location.
review.positiveRemarks: The people and the clean, fresh look and feel of the hotel and room.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a full restaurant and a small toiletries and snacks option.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants; Chinatown is literally 50 feet away; the other districts are no more than a 20 minute walk which my wife and I took several times.

review.title: Fantastic location - excellent rooms
review.reviewText: Within walking distance of some excellent restaurants in San Francisco - no need to take your car out once you arrive.  Friendly and very helpful staff at front desk.

review.title: Very Comfortable and Friendly hotel
review.reviewText: We have just returned from an 8 night stay at the hotel.  It was excellent.  The staff are wonderful especially Ricky, Janny and Tiffany who helped us out with information frequently.  The hotel is small and compact.  It is very clean and the bedrooms and bathroom are very well laid out and a good size.  We especially loved the fridge in the room as we were able to buy groceries in the store and have breakfast most mornings in the room.  We had breakfast twice in the hotel and it was very tasty whilst the dining room was lovely and relaxing. If I returned to San Francixco I would stay at the Orchard Garden.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, comfortable rooms and cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the only improvement would be if the hotel restaurant opened for dinner in the evening.  They are doing a great job.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is situated almost beside chinatown.  It is handy for Union Square and other shops and restaurants.  It is a ten minute walk to transport.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, rooms are very nice, clean, great bathroom, and basic amenities . Located within blocks to Union Square on a gentle hill.

review.title: Great facility so central
review.reviewText: My wife and had 2 wonderful nights in this neat and tidy and clean hotel so central in San Francisco- all staff were extremely helpful with Broc and Ricky standouts .

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText:
Near Union Square.  Next door to Chinatown and one block from Belden Place.
Great staff and immaculate rooms.

review.title: Excellent choice!
review.reviewText: Location great made stepping to Chinatown super easy, grabbing coffee, all employees were terrific especially Broc the doorman!  really happy staying there.

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet hotel. Awesome front desk staff-- called me by name the entire stay and recommended a great local restaurant. Excellent location right by Chinatown and close to Union Square. Lovely rooftop area to have a drink and look at the city/skyline.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in s great spot.
review.reviewText: Love it here. Stay here whenever I'm in town. Never fails to deliver. Luxurious yet not overstated. Everything is elegant. The staff are fantastic and it is located right next to China town and lots of great eating and shopping.

review.title: Very nice and clean hotel.
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Valet parking is offered. Rooms are very clean. Maid service is provided two times a day. Would definitely comeback again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are decent size.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Right next door to Chinatown and walking distance to Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel in a perfect location to do a lot.
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden Hotel is perfect for someone that is looking to do a ton of things in and around Union Square, Downtown and some of the touristy things in SF.  It could use a little bit of updating(nothing has changed in the 10 years since it opened), but the staff was very friendly, room was comfortable, and we had a very nice time there.

review.title: Nice location next to China town and shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly and professional.  Great centralized location in the city next to China Town and shopping.  Rooms were very clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. clean rooms, professional staff
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.  It was all good
review.locationRemarks: Next to shopping, China Town, mass transit

review.reviewText: Is not worth the price, I did not perceive or value it as a 4 star hotel

review.title: Close to China town.
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff. Rooms wifi excellent and the location is perfect for tourists.

review.title: Centrally located in the Financial District.
review.reviewText: Overall, I nice hotel.  Friendly staff, clean rooms and quiet!  Received a complimentary room upgrade at check in.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish they would have had a bar/lounge in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to Chinatown and Union Square.  Plenty of local restaurants to close from.

review.title: Hotel is literally a few steps from China Town
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were amazing. The room was clean as expected. The hotel room was a little pricey though.

review.title: Central location in S.F.
review.reviewText: The rooms and service were excellent. You could walk to almost anything in central S.F.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were very modern, clean, and up to date. The staff could not have been more helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was inconvenient, but they did the best they could to make it easy to get around.
review.locationRemarks: There is just so much to do in S.F. There were restaurants, China Town, museums and easy access to the wharf and Embarcadero.

review.title: Next door to China Town
review.reviewText:
Beware of the "additional costs" mentioned when booking.  These are not specified, so here are the actual figures, hotel  valet car Park is $50 plus tax ($57 per day) parking is very limited in the city.  
Put up bed for was charged at $50 per night which was a rip off considering we were already paying $770 for three night plus local tax.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi connection broke 1st night.  On check in you are given a help desk number to call for Wifi problems.  Must happen on a regular basis.  Fix it.
review.locationRemarks: Next door to Chinatown.  Few minutes walk  to Union Square for shops, trolley car down to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Excellent staff
review.reviewText: Every employee of this hotel was helpful and pleasant.  The rooms were spotless after the morning service, and the evening bed turndown was a bonus.  The breakfasts, though pricey, were enough to feed a small village, and they were very tasty.  The hotel was convenient to public transportation and to many eateries.  It's a great place.
Good location. Bed is very confortable. All staff nice and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Chinatown
review.reviewText: Clean room. Not overly spacious for the price paid. Bed was okay. Cupboard door to fridge was broken. Might stay again, but would look at other options first. Perhaps we got one of the smaller, more run down rooms because we booked through Expedia?
review.negativeRemarks: maintenance of room
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown. Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, ferry terminal, Lombard St, etc.

review.title: Our first visit to San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and very helpful with directions!!....hotel was very close to cable cars and Bart...highly recommend and will stay there again

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: Conveniently located- Union Square/Chinatown area. Room colors were gold and olive green-not the best decorated room I have stayed in. No chair to sit and relax - we had to sit on our bed.
review.negativeRemarks: room need to be brighter with a clean, crisp look- very drab now.
review.locationRemarks: close to Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: No City Views
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a good location. Don't purchase the upgrade to 'city view". It's more appropriately described as street view.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit dated.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to the Dragon Gate. Good location to Chinatown, Union Square, shopping, ferry terminal and Pier 39.

review.title: Great Hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: the TV wasnt very good - cable channels were fuzzy at the higher end.  they offered to change rooms but we just lived with it.  other than that the room was good and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: we were in room 205 - no view what so ever.  we looked at a brickwall
review.locationRemarks: close to subway - montgomery, close to Muni buses.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great staff. Very helpful. The location was ideal. We were able to walk all over the city

review.title: Decent Value near Chinatown and Financial District
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, though because it's so close to the Financial District, I had a somewhat challenging time finding meals nearby in the evening and on the weekend. Also, their "fitness center" consists only of 3 aerobic machines. Otherwise, it's perfectly adequate.

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located
review.reviewText:
Very convenient, nice and comfortable. Nice services.


Would go again.    Close to Union sq.

review.title: Pool guy visits San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This hotel is right on the border of Chinatown and Union Square  these are the best places for shopping and dining in the city   With the hotel centrally located you can take any number of public transportation to get around you can take the cable car, A streetcar  A double-decker bus or a cab if you like and be anywhere in the city in about 10 minutes 
My wife and I suggest if you're going to spend more than a couple days to buy a three day pass and you can ride any form of public transportation for 1 fee this does not include taxis or ferry service  we both highly recommend the Alcatraz tour  we stayed at the Orchard Garden very clean hotel very nice staff room was very small and wasn't impressed with it at all but the cleanly Ness and the staff  made up for it also wasn't impressed with the TV but you don't go to San Francisco  to watch TV so this worked out  overall was one of the best trips we've ever had people in  San Francisco were great it was a second honeymoon for me and my wife also if you have the chance bike across the Golden gate Bridge and go to Sausalito  they rent bikes at fisherman's wharf and you can bike to Sausalito and take a ferry back for a good time that is the ticket If we had more time we would spend it in Sausalito thanks for reading our review the pool guy

review.title: Great location, very clean hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located next to the Dragon Gate and a few blocks from Union Square. It's spacious and extremely clean.

review.title: Bright and modern rooms.
review.reviewText: Pleasure trip to see the sights. Spent three days in the city to see all the signs. Bus tour was most helpful in getting a taste of what there was to see and do. Fisher mans wharf a bit touristy but the marine museum was interesting. Pay the fee to go into the ships. Worth it. Book way ahead for Alcatraz because it is popular. Rent a bike to go over the GG Bridge and take a ferry back. Highly recommended. Lots to see!
review.positiveRemarks: Bright modern room decor. Comfortable beds. Easy to control thermostat. Lots of mirrors. Roomy bathroom with soft towels. Room darkening drapes.
review.negativeRemarks: Another shelf in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine.  Near China town good restaurants and public transportation

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: Very good hotel to walk around downtown. Nice restaurants are close to the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel at a great location!
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel as a package on Expedia. I've never really been to San Francisco before and didn't really know in what location to stay. Once we arrived to the hotel we were greates by their lovely staff and they offered us a list of places to visit and eat at. The rooms were super clean and loved everything about the hotel included their roof top! The location of the hotel was great! We were walking distance to Chinatown and Union square. I would definitely come back and stay at this hotel for my next trip.

review.title: Great area, Chinatown
review.reviewText: Chinatown, cable cars, shopping, Fisherman's Wharf, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel doesn't offer dining.  Roots Restaurant not open for lunch or dinner.   Only offers ala carte breakfast if part of package.
review.locationRemarks:
Easy access to everything. We hired a cab for a night lights tour..better than the tour company's offering.
Chinatown, Cable Cars,  Shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown
review.reviewText: Everything is within walking distance or mass transit. Staff were awesome!

review.title: Nice Hotel and excellent staff
review.reviewText: We were 3 nights, from that arrived at the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is very suitable to be in Union Square, and the value for money quality is fine. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation the rooms, tv is urgent.
review.locationRemarks: close to everything, in union square, Chinatown and the financial distrtito side.

review.title: Very nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel Super Bowl weekend arriving on Thursday.  Ricky the doorman greeted us curbside and set the tone for what be a lovely stay.  The hotel has a small restaurant which only provides breakfast which was fine.  Located nearby are many restaurants within walking distance and if you needed a cab they were only to happy to get one for you.  The entire staff of the hotel was welcoming and very informative, providing maps with details of how to get around and making excellent recommendations for dinner.  Unfortunately I was on crutches at the time of our visit but the hotel had a wheelchair for me to borrow at no charge. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable.  The pillows and comforter were like sleeping on a cloud affording both my husband and myself some needed sound restful sleep.  There is a pretty outdoor rooftop garden on top of the hotel that looks out on the city.  There are tables and chairs to sit up there to relax and just enjoy the beautiful weather and sounds of the city.  All in all this hotel was a five star experience for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was amazing. Very friendly, helpful.  Room nice size, clean, comfortable,  Breakfast very fresh with nice selection.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel parking was expensive even though you were permitted to take car in and out at no extra charge
review.locationRemarks: Great location  Close to Chinatown, Mascone Center, Fishermans Wharf, Cable Cars, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Good Hotel in a Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Friendliest staff you could ask for in a big city.  Stayed for two nights (three days) in San Francisco and would definitely return to this hotel again.  Easy access to Montgomery Street metro (if you prefer not to cab it from the airport).  Check out the rooftop garden, but there is a secret to getting there.  Only one of the elevators accesses the garden.  So on the ground floor, press the down button, and the correct elevator will arrive.  Then ride it up to the top floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff.  New facilities.  Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Space is limited in the hotel, but the fitness center could use an upgrade.  Would be nice for a weight machine (or free weights) to be added.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown.  Financial District.  Union Square.  Shopping.  Theaters.  The hotel is in the center of it all.

review.title: Nice hotel right near the Chinatown gate
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, close to Chinatown gate. My room was big with comfortable king bed. The staff comes to check/clean room 2 times a day. Also they have high speed  internet, which is included in price.
review.negativeRemarks: There were a bunch of drinks in the fridge and there was no place to put anything. I think it'd be better to have not to have all that in the fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is really close, the hotel is almost in financial district. There are a lot of stores nearby.

review.reviewText: Great location, clean, comfortable and a great fluffy bed! :-)

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: I never had to use my car, many things within walking distance

review.title: Pre- Nike Race stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel the night before the Women's Nike Half Marathon and it was very nice.  The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the hotel was quiet...meaning we did not hear any street noise.  We were able to get a good night sleep and we were close to the starting line for the race.  We would definitely stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel again.

review.title: Nice hotel near china town and union square
review.reviewText: Hotel made my daughter and I reservations for the stop and go bus. The hotel staff is very friendly.

review.title: beautiful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
we had a great experience at orchard gardens. the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable, including scheduling a spa treatment for my spouse and giving directions.
The hotel is neat, clean, comfortable, great location and very attractive renovation. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to be in the city.
review.locationRemarks: the  hotel sits on the border of china town, nob hill and the financial district Dining is in walking distance.

review.title: Great Hotel- excellent location
review.reviewText: Spacious and comfortable rooms, free wifi, great location- easy access to transport, great eating places and shops
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Shops and great restaurants and gastro pubs around Union Square.

review.title: Excellent location. Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable and well located. Efficient and friendly staff. The breakfast is excellent value for money and freshly cooked. If I had to make one slightly negative comment it would be that the shower pressure could be much better. We spoke to another guest who had no problem with shower pressure so perhaps it depends on what part of the building you're in. We were on the 5th floor. We would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, friendly, helpful staff. Very clean with comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower pressure.
review.locationRemarks: Only about 3 blocks from union square and next door to China gate.

review.title: Very convenient for Union Square area
review.reviewText:
Standard King Room. Impeccably clean, unfortunately no 'views' except buildings. Staff extremely courteous and attentive to any minor requests.  Mentioned a slight issue with shower nozzle when passing Reception, walked to Lift and found I was sharing it with Staff member on his way to my Room to fix it !
I'd have no hesitation in booking this Hotel if and when I return to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of Hotel and friendliness of Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi very occasionally 'dropped out', but never for too long
review.locationRemarks: Two short Block walk South then same West, you're in Union Square. City Tour Bus stop 50 yards away. 'Healthy' walk to Ferry Bldg.

review.title: Really great city hotel
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, just feet away from China town and a great walk down to all the pier's. The only
minus point would be there is no bar for a late night glass of wine on the terrace, however there are loads of wine bars around the area , great stay , would recommend. 😀

review.title: Nice hotel next to Chinatown and Union square
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel bedding was cozy. I would stay here again
Great room. Green concept is inline with my values.

review.title: Comfortable stay in a great location
review.reviewText: The location is great for exploring the city. It is close to all the downtown restaurants and shops and right next to the China Town gate and a few blocks away from Little Italy. The room was spacious and quiet (double room 402) and the beds are super comfortable. I can definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Downtown/Chinatown
review.reviewText: Friendly knowledgeable staff.  Bar in hotel but was not open..disappointment if you like a cocktail, although plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance.  Only 6 or so TV  stations even though their guide in the room indicated the normal 20 or so that you typically find. Comfy bed. Clean, nice basic room, quiet.  No view in our room.  Around the corner from Chinatown.  Valet parking $50 per night + taxes.  Certainly no reason not to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: TV stations, Open bar

review.title: Hotel is close to China Town and BART
review.reviewText: Short but comfortable stay. Nice oriental styling in the lobby but not overwhelming.

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText: I took my wife to San Francisco to celebrate her 60th birthday. We were both pleasantly surprised by the convenient location and the excellent facilities offered by the Orchard Garden Hotel. The staff, especially Spencer, were friendly, helpful and informative. This was our first time in San Francisco, so the information we were given about restaurants, transportation and sites to see were very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to explore San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The clean room, the quiet atmosphere, comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing needs to be improved.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located at the gate to Chinatown so there are literally hundreds of restaurants and shops a short walk from the hotel.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We are in San Francisco a lot and have used many different hotels.  This one is great if you want to have access to a lot of the city.  Everyone there was very nice, especially Phil, the doorman.  The rooms are not very big but most SF rooms are this way.  The hotel only has breakfast service which was disappointing until we realized all the great places to eat within a blocks walk.  I would definitely go back to this hotel!

review.title: Great hotel near Chinatown
review.reviewText:
We found this hotel to be in a convenient walking location to many of the places we wanted to visit.  It is close to Chinatown, Union Square, about 40 minutes walk to Fisherman’s Wharf and easy access to many restaurants…Asian, Italian, Subway, Starbuck, etc, all within walking distance. 

We enjoyed our stay here as the room was clean, quiet, has roomy bathroom and the staff were always pleasant and very helpful especially Ricky and Phil.  Overall, an awesome hotel and a great stay!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, cleanliness and awesome staff.
review.negativeRemarks: the safe was set up too high...it's hard to reach

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Art was great. We asked him about places to eat, drink and things to do. He had great suggestions. He helped to book us on an half day Napa wine tour which picked us up at the hotel. I wish there was an Art at our next hotel in Seattle because they did not know anything at all in Seattle.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved Art and the rest staff. Great location to everything.
review.locationRemarks: At the gate of Chinatown

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located! just a few steps to just about anywhere you may want to go in Downtown San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: My room did not have a view of the city.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to China Town.

review.reviewText:
Excellent situated near China town and very close to hop on - hop off busses and cable car. 
Safe area. Helpful and friendly hotel staff.

review.title: excellsnt hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel us excellent location for Union Square and Chinatown. Hop on/off buses stop just outside do again excellent. Staff very helpful and hotel very quiet considering the central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing obvious!

review.title: Welcoming
review.reviewText: Being greeted at the door and the front desk after a long day of travel was so nice. The room smelled fresh and was very clean. Very roomy, especial the spacious bathroom. The location was near China town, north beach, union square, easy access to many restaurants, all within walking distance. Overall a great stay.
Comfortable hotel within walking distance of Chinatown and Union Square.  Room was very very quiet.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel had the basic room, small but conveniently located to everything so you can walk everywhere. Nice staff, clean rooms, quick easy check-in. Good value for the price paid.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Chinatown and 2 blocks from Union Square. Restaurants, coffee shops, and bars in close proximity to hotel.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because of its sustainability commitments - it was a HUGE bonus that it was in a perfect location, very comfortable, and had lovely staff. We were able to either walk to or easily transit to everywhere we wanted to go, like Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard St, Golden Gate Park, Palace of the Arts, China Town, etc. We had a view of a parkade but were only there to sleep so it didn't matter. Definitely recommend and will be back one day!

review.title: San Francisco Headquarters
review.reviewText:
Stayed at Orchard Garden during my first visit to SF.  A great place to return to and relax in after a long day of sightseeing and walking the steep hills.

Very conveniently located 1/4 block from China Town and a few blocks from the Financial District, you can literally walk out your door and be close enough to reach everything if you're a serious city explorer.

Directly across the street is a fantastic french cafe, Starbucks is on the diagonal intersection, and a tasty, popular Italian eatery is only 2 blocks away.
review.negativeRemarks: In room amenities are a bit dated.
review.locationRemarks: Literally 1/4 block from the China Town entrance, and a StarBucks is on the diagonal corner if you can't live without it.

review.reviewText: Good location and friendly staff. Room was on the small side.

review.title: Perfect location central near shopping & China tow
review.reviewText: Had some issues with my door not opening so had to rely on the porter to open for me the first day. Other than that a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: General modernisation.
review.locationRemarks: China town, shopping, sightseeing.

review.title: Nice hotel for 1st time San Fran visitors
review.reviewText: Close to eating places and public transportation.  Hotel staff were very nice and helpful especially Art the Bellman. He was extremely helpful. He saved us a lot of searching by giving us ideas for things to do and see.  Would recommend this hotel to others!
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, shopping, restaurants, public transportation

review.reviewText:
First time in San Francisco and we have been amazed by everything .
I recommend it 100 percent .

review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: We were here for a three night stay from LA to watch the Dodger/Giant match up! The hotel was clean, convenient and the hotel staff was nice. They serviced our room twice a day! Once for a refresh and a second bedding turn down/chocolate drop off for the evening. Overall a great experience. We walked everywhere from Little Italy (10 mins), Fishermens Wharf (25 mins) to AT&T Park (25 mins). Close access to the Bart off Montgomery (5 min walk) to avoid the $42 taxi ride! Only cons are the place seems overpriced for a room with no view that is fairly tiny with no sitting area. For three nights we paid $800 after taxes. This did not include breakfast which is $14/person daily! We visited a bfast spot called "The Working Girl Cafe" that is just a block away each day. Coffee and great breakfast sandwiches for $8 total.

review.title: Attention to sustainability
review.reviewText: I like to put my money where my values are and the Orchard Hotel aligns with my concerns about waste. They are a LEED certified hotel and really mean it when they say they won't change your towel unless you request.  Lovely to boot

review.title: Lovely hotel close enough for everything
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights here at the start of our trip. It's right next to China town and close to union square. We also managed to walk to the piers, unfortunately as we were strolling I have no idea how long it took us but the walk was pleasant. Staff here were friendly and helpful, answering questions about getting places etc. the room was clean and reasonably sized. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was lovely.

review.title: Front Desk
review.reviewText:
Mr Collins  who is in charge of the front Desk,was very helpful and charming to us as we had a small problem with our booking.I think he sensed we were tired and did what he could for us including an upgrade.
I cannot comment on the restaurant as we ate elsewhere.The restaurant is very bland and did not fit our  mood.
Actually the décor is very bland all over,, and the hotel cant really decide if its oriental, western or fusion and is none of these things .So a low rating for décor but high on personal service.

review.title: Wedding Anniversary
review.reviewText: We spent only one night at the hotel but it was so worth it. The hotel upgraded us to a wonderful terrace suite with great views of the area. The hotel staff were very helpful with all of our questions and needs and went out of their way to acknowledge our anniversary with a card and chocolates in the room. We will make sure to use them again in our future stays in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was beautiful and the rooms very well done. It was the staff that made it shine though!!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and China Town. Easily walked to.

review.title: Good location in downtown SF
review.reviewText: No problems but carpet is worn and service is just ok nothing extraordinary.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Friendly staff, great location and rooms!
review.reviewText: The staff I encountered were all friendly and efficient--there's even a doorman there most hours.  The rooms are clean and updated, with eco-friendly touches like room-key activation of electricity and soap, shampoo, and conditioner dispenser in the shower.  Bed was very comfortable. Great location for China Town, Union Square, Financial District, or the waterfront.  There's even a nice rooftop patio to take in the skyline.  My only nitpick is that the on-site workout room is very small (1 each treadmill, bike, eliptical), but the front desk has $15 passes to 24-hour Fitness, which has a location just 3 blocks away.  I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location.  Friendly staff.  Clean, updated room.  Additional nice touches.
review.negativeRemarks: The workout room is small, but it's a small hotel so understandable.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel sits next to the entrance to China Town.  Just a few blocks from Union Square and the waterfront.  Shops, cafes, restaurants all around.

review.title: Good location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Room are clean and the people are nice and helpful. Would recommend
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Chinatown

review.title: Nice hotel - great location!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to Chinatown and Union Square. Will stay here again!

review.title: Good value, well located, boutique
review.reviewText: Stayed here twice and found it to be quite well run and well appointed. It is right by the entrance to Chinatown and has a plethora of restaurants and cafes nearby. Within walking distance of wharf areas, great shopping and cable cars. Enjoy.
The hotel was clean (and green!).  Great location within walking distance of many attractions.  The staff (especially Nathan) went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks:
Great location
Extremely helpful and friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Union Square, North Beach, Financial District, Chinatown, Coit Tower, Ferry Building and Piers

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: this hotel is located within feet of the Chinatown gate and the financial district. Excellent service and friendly staff, nice breakfast also.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText:
One of the friendliest hotels we have ever stayed out, friendly eager staff, always happy to go that extra mile.

Valet parking was one of the cheapest ion the City.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location is very near Union Square and the Chinese sector.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, outstanding service
review.reviewText: i want to thank Art for the service that he gave to us, organising tours, car for the airport, general knowledge about the area, great guy with 100% the best customer service that we have ever received!!!
review.positiveRemarks: It's so clean, beautiful and welcoming. We felt very safe as a family in the hotel and enjoyed our stay, didn't want to leave.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!! It's perfect!!
review.locationRemarks: We loved Fishermans Wharf about 20 minutes away and found it very easy to get to either by end of tour drop off or the fantastic historic cable cars.

review.reviewText: great location! It's right next to China town and a short distance from Union square. The staff was very friendly. Only thing that was bad for us was that we couldn't look out our windows all weekend because they were cleaning them and our toilet kept breaking down but other than that it's a great place to stay.
Quick tour of San Francisco.  Great location!  Right next door to Chinatown, close to Union Square.  Quite a hike to Fisherman's Wharf, but we were able to walk it.

review.title: Guest ratings don't lie!
review.reviewText: Great location and price for San Francisco. You can walk or jump on transportation to get to all the attractions, food, shopping SF has to offer. The hotel was efficient, attractive and clean. The roof top garden was a pleasure on a beautiful Sunday morning, great for coffee or an evening cocktail. Free wifi is always a plus. Check in and check out were fast, they called when the room was ready since we arrived in the morning and they stored our luggage on both ends of our stay. I would definitely go back.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location
Efficient in check-in and check-out
Free wifi
Very attractive finishings
review.negativeRemarks: If I have to identify something to improve, I would add a free breakfast with the room.....
review.locationRemarks: Close to transportation but could also walk to Great shopping, food, and many of the attractions.

review.title: Great hotel near Union square
review.reviewText: Orchard Garden hotel is in a great location with wonderful staff.

review.title: DESK RECEPTIOION SEEMED TO RESENT THAT I WAS AN EX
review.reviewText: THE DESK CLERK SEEMED UNINTERESTED IN EXPLAINING OR HELPING ME CHECK-IN WITHOUT ACTUALLY BEING DISCOURTEOUS. I HE MADE AN OFF-HANDED REMARK ABOUT EXPEDIA AND GAVE US A ROOM ON A VERY LOW FLOOR IN THE BACK OVER AN ALLEY. I WAS TIRED AND WANTED TO RELAX AFTER A LONG TRIP, SO I DID NOT COLMPLAIN OR WISH TO HAVE THE ROOM CHANGED. THEHOTEL WAS VERY, VERY QUIET AND THERE WERE NEVER MORE THAN 6 PEOPLE AT BREAKFAST SO I DOUBT THAT THEY WERE BOOKED. I WOULD NEVER GO BACK THERE. THEY HAVE LOST A POTENTIALLY GOOD CUSTOMER AS I WILL BE RETURNING TO SAN FRANCISCO. THIS WAS THE ONLY DISSAPPOINTMENT IN AN OTHERWISE PERFECT TRIP.
review.positiveRemarks: I LIKED THE BEDDING AND THE MAID SERVICE.
review.negativeRemarks: THE DESK CHECK-IN ATTITUDE
review.locationRemarks: AN EXCELLENT LOCATION FOR RESTAURANTS, FINANCIAL CENTER AND CHINATOWN.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a perfectly sized boutique hotel close to lots of great restaurants and shopping. We walked to the wharf without trouble, we rented bikes close to the hotel and rode across the Golden Gate Bridge and the staff was extremely helpful in giving us tips for sightseeing. We enjoyed our two night stay and would return again.

review.title: Central hotel close to union sq
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable hotel close to union sq. Very well placed for shopping, restaurants and bars within the area. Also, close to excellent transport links for sightseeing. Hotel itself is clean, with comfortable beds and hotel staff are very courteous and helpful. Recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel near Chinatown
review.reviewText: Great hotel close to Union Square and one building away from the Chinatown Gate. Comfortable bed, quiet room (at the back.)  staff was attentive without being overbearing. Great breakfast, especially the vegetarian, with grilled asparagus, carrots, tomatoes, and mushrooms.  Coffee was good as well.  Large bathroom, room itself was a bit tight, but it seems this is usual for San Francisco.  We had a great couples getaway and would highly recommend the Orchard Garden Hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown!  Lots to see here, go 2 blocks off the main tourist street for great bakery, foods, and to see the Chinese markets.

review.title: Comfortable Location!
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco to enjoy the food, bread and breathtaking views after first being there 20 years ago! We simply wanted a place to sleep, not spending much time in the room.  This location and hotel fit the bill perfectly.  Enjoyed our stay very much!
review.positiveRemarks: location, nice, clean rooms and the validation that the rooms are "quiet"...lived up to the reviews I had read on-line from other customers.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in good location. Staff were helpful and friendly which gives the hotel a lovely atmosphere. Rooms were cleaned everyday and promptly. Sandwiched between Chinatown and the financial district makes it a good location. Just be wary of Tenderloin district and particularly the stretch of Market Street which runs through Tenderloin. Not a nice area. Otherwise everywhere else is safe.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very nice. Clean hotel in a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice if the hotel had 24 hour room service. Only breakfast is offered.

review.reviewText: Good location in union.square area yet quiet rooms with little outside noise.  Exceptionally clean hotel with a very helpful and pleasant staff..
Our room was very clean, very friendly staff and helpfull.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Room was great, very clean very quiet staff was awesome

review.title: Friendly staff, disappointing "amenities".
review.reviewText: Close to Chinatown, friendly staff.  Rates were comparatively good.  The "fitness center" consisted of one elliptical machine, one bike and one treadmill - no weights.  One of the "amenities" was a hotel-branded "intimacy kit" that was right next to the generic single-serve coffee condiments.  I suppose that may be useful for some, but was a bit off-putting for me.  Room was small.  At times, it was noisy at night.

review.title: Pleasant Hotel Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel; excellent location next to Chinatown Gate; clean and quiet; courteous staff. Very eco-friendly.
Great rooftop views.

review.title: Great Hotel.  Close to everything
review.reviewText:
The staff was amazing.  So helpful with what I should see and do. 

I will stay here again in the future
It was nice and quiet and located near everything that I wanted to see.

review.title: Very sustainable hotel
review.reviewText: Nice amenities and staff, steps from the entrance to China Town, hotel is very "green" without sacrificing any luxury.
Nice hotel in a nice location. Pleasant, clean, friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME
review.reviewText: I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS HOTEL.  THE LOCATION, THE STAFF, THE ROOMS (GREAT BATHROOMS).  I GO AND NEVER WANT TO LEAVE.
review.locationRemarks: LOCATED AT THE GATE TO CHINATOWN THE HOTEL IS CONVENIENT TO WALK TO MANY PLACES OF INTEREST AND A SHORT DISTANCE TO UNION SQUARE AND GREAT RESTAURANTS

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. If you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay that is within 5 minutes walking distance from Union Square or China Town, this is the place to stay. Valet parking was also reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Better Pillows. Queen beds instead of double.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China town, and the mall are within walking distance.

review.reviewText: Really close to everything i needed to get to.  Staff was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and that staff were really nice.  Location was good for getting to lots of places.

review.title: Management Didn't Do the Right Thing
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the hotel on a business trip 11/2/14 and accidently booked the room for Saturday night instead of Sunday.  When I explained the situation to Nathan at guest services he was very polite and sorry that had happened and called his manager to see what could be done.  The manager said there was nothing they could do and could not give me a credit or refund even though there were 15 rooms available for that night.  When I acknowledged it was totally my fault for booking the wrong day the manager said there was still nothing that could be done because that was their policy.  I'm all for policy, however, when you have an opportunity as a business to make things right and not be out one penny in doing so, its foolish not to do it.  By not doing so they gave up not only my future business but my friends, family, and anyone who doesn't stay there based on this and other reviews.  Hotel staff great except for the manager.

Common sense isn't so common - Voltaire

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText:
Stayed here with my husband and two teenage boys in October 2014, the hotel is in an excellent position right next to the China Town Gate and ideal for all the trams, streetcars, buses, muni metro and Bart train stop from the airport. 
Check in and out was very efficient by friendly staff, who are always available to help and advise you on what ever you needed. 
The hotel is spotless, our room was comfortable even with four people in it!
Small gym and a business centre with computers and a printer available to use.  Also a small garden terrace overlooking the city where we had a picnic one day.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, cleanliness and the Eco friendly ethics of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Only problem we encountered was having to ask for four towels because they kept leaving only three, not sure why as it was a four berth room!
review.locationRemarks: Very close to all types of transport links and very central for all tourist spots, also Ferry terminals to Alcatraz and Sausalito.

review.title: Hotel in central San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a small and very comfortable hotel near Union Square.  The room we had was towards the back of the hotel and so it was very quiet which made sleeping easy.
review.positiveRemarks: Very impressed with this hotel's very fast and efficient wifi system and it was FREE.  The room size was very adequate for most people's requirements.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown was just around the corner and is close to Union Square and shopping. There is a bus stop for the off/on bus just outside the hotel entrance

review.title: Central hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very pleasant ,helpful and obliging staff, able to meet our needs throughout our stay.green hotel , recycles
review.positiveRemarks: We were very impressed in particular with one staff member Phil, always happy to help, smiling and going the extra step to help
review.locationRemarks: one door down from china town, close to starbucks and cable cars

review.reviewText: The location was fantastic.  We walked to the Workd Series at AT&T Park -25 min walk, but so worth it not dealing with a car or any surface transportation, public or private.  Walked to Lefty Odouls in Union Square after the game.  Walked to breakfast in the morning, to the Irish Bank for a few pregame pints of Guiness.  And a quick 7 min walk to BART.   Yeah you'll spend 3 Bills, but if you're going to the City, this is a good value without feeling like your going to a budget hotel.  Perfect trade off without getting seriously gauged.

review.title: Nice clean hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is just on the edge of China town and not too far from the BART.  Room was excellent and very clean an no bed bugs (yes I checked first).  Lovely crisp white bedding.  Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful.  Good breakfast, worth the money.   Would definitely stay here again if in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: We were visiting multiple cities in the United States. Due to delay of one of the flights, we were unable to get to San Francisco on schedule. The hotel manager was very understanding, and although we could not cancel the first day's accommodation in time (24 hours before), he has kindly emailed to grant us a free cancellation for that day.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly reception staff who were always willing to assist.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be more comfortable if the room was larger.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is next to the gateway of China Town, many restaurants to try if one likes Asian food

review.title: Close to everything in downtown, next to chinatown
review.reviewText: Staff are friendly, rooms are clean. I loved the rooftop view, too bad you cant see Bush street in front of the hotel, only the corner of grant and bush.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel common area & rooms are well appointed. Hotel is convenient to everything. Would definitely stay here the next time we're in town.

review.title: nice place very clean and pleasant
review.reviewText: very well run hotel, the staff was friendly and the room was comfortable.

review.title: Well situated hotel
review.reviewText: Good location between financial district and Union Square. Plenty of eateries nearby and easy walk to Westfield Mall. The hotel suited our needs perfectly

review.title: Beautiful hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText:
My second stay at Orchard Garden after an excellent experience first time round. Everything was just as good as before, with friendly staff, clean and impressive interiors and a location within walking distance of everything in downtown. The rooms are small to modest in size, but well presented and the bathroom is spacious and bright.

San Francisco is expensive. No getting around that. If you want to stay near downtown you have to part with a painful amount of money. Orchard Garden isn't cheap, but compares favourably with other hotels in the area and I will definitely be returning next time I'm in SF.
review.locationRemarks: A few seconds from the Dragon Gate and Chinatown, a few minutes from the financial district, Market St and Montgomery BART station.

review.title: Quiet hotel in good location
review.reviewText: we found this hotel to be in a convenient walking location in SF to many otf the places we wanted to visit. The room was comfortable, good bed and bedding, nice design features.
review.negativeRemarks: too many things cluttering the surfaces (mini bar items, internet and hotel literature, etc.)
review.locationRemarks: chinatown, Grace church, Union Square, shopping, Ferry Building shopping, Jewish Museum.

review.title: Modern hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Good location close to Union Square and the Chinese area. Very clean, well laid out rooms. Beds very comfortable. Quiet. Staff very friendly and helpful. During our stay, I was admitted, as an emergency to hospital at 1am. The staff were extremely helpful and thoughtful in helping arrange my admission. On discharge, I needed 2 or 3 days to regain strength. Our stay was extended (in the same room) with a minimum amount of fuss (and at a good rate!). Excellent good value breakfasts
review.locationRemarks: As above. Several good restaurants very close

review.title: First visit to San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Good location for first time in San Fransisco. Very helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is not too large, so didn't have to wait to be assisted at reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Prefer in room fridge that you can place own items in.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Union Square and Chinatown.  We also walked from  Pier 39 back to the hotel which took around 40 minutes, so not too difficult.

review.title: my mother for her 80th birthday treat
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only criticism is that the gym is a lot smaller than it looks on the website with very limited machines
review.negativeRemarks: Gym facilities
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Union Square and China Town, and easy access to buses trams and BART trains

review.title: Four nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Efficient and kind staff, hotel is centrally located but quiet enough. Room was showing signs of wear though and our junior suite view was dismal - it looked into a backyard! Nonetheless, we would use it again.

review.title: Literally right next to the Chinatown gate
review.reviewText: The room was OK clean--I found a hair on the bathroom sink and the tv remote controller felt a bit sticky. The sound proof was not great or the room next to mine was exceptionally loud. At night, it felt like there were at least 4 people in the room next to mine (because of the talking noise) and also in the morning they opened and closed the door several times, at least 10 times, in about 10 minutes, which woke me up.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, literally 10 meters from the Chinatown gate.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Union Square, Montgomery BART station

review.title: Holiday in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel due to its location, staff and cleanliness.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location only a few minutes walk from Union Square, very clean and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: A bar and restaurant within the hotel would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Situated next to China Town and within easy walking distance of Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel next to chinatown
review.reviewText: I attended a meeting at the Moscone convention center. Orchard garden hotel was a nice, reasonably priced hotel about 10 minutes walk away.  Staff was very friendly and room was clean. Excellent hotel!

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, super friendly and helpful staff, excellent location. Will definitely choose back Orchard Garden if I come back to San Francisco!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We had a very good experience at the Orchard Garden. The room was very clean and well maintained.  The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were a little softer than we prefer.  The only problem we had was that the minifridge barely worked.  The staff was very friendly, and the valet parking was quick and convenient.  The location was convenient for us to walk to a variety of places, and it's right at the gates to chinatown.  The restaurant was pricy, mediocre, and only open very weird hours, but they recommended several good neighborhood places.
review.locationRemarks: Great location right at the gates to Chinatown and a quick walk to both Union Square or the Ferry Building.

review.title: Clean and close to alot of attractions.
review.reviewText:
Hotel was nothing special from the outside but was super clean, bed was so comfy, loved the warm showers,
Front desk clerk - Tina was fantastic, just a no fuss atmosphere. Walking distance to so many attractions.
I was very impressed with this hotel and would definitely recommend it to friends and family who want a clean, fresh, comfortable place to unwind at night.
Would have been nice to have a lounge downstairs for drinks and appies in the evening. Some of the staff were definitely more helpful than others and coming from a hospitality background I think the front desk is a bit cold and unwelcoming.
Overall everything else was great!!
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are very clean!!!and I am very fussy about that when travelling.
review.negativeRemarks: More inviting and fun atmosphere in the lobby and front desk !!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown, Union Square, Financial District and so many other tourist attractions.

review.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel.  The room and staff were excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was immaculate. Everything was top notch!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: The BART was only a couple of blocks away. China Town was just around the corner. There were many restaurants, cafés and coffee shops nearby.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise.  It is within walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach and the Embarcadero so you are close to many fine restaurants and shopping areas.  The room was on the small side, but clean and comfortable.  The staff was amazing--the friendliest and most helpful I have ever encountered.  The only drawback (and it would not dissuade us from staying there again) was the street noise outside.  We had a room that faced the street and it was a little loud at times.  Next time, we would ask for an interior room.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I loved this smaller, quiet hotel with a great location near Union Square! The room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was attentive and helpful. Price was reasonable.

review.title: Quick overnight visit
review.reviewText: We spent an overnight here after a cruise on the Star Princess. We arrived about 10 AM and although we had asked for a possible early arrival, they didn't have our room ready yet. No problem. We checked our bags then sat in the lobby to look at maps and get our bearings. Before we even got up to leave Katrina said the room was ready! We had a King Room with a view. The room was impeccably clean and plenty spacious. We were on the second floor and the view was directly across the street to the sides of other buildings and we were not very far above the heads of the folks going by on the top of the double decker buses. Street noise wasn't an issue except a car alarm went of briefly about 0530. A higher floor might have been a bit better view but now that I've seen it we'd likely not get a VIEW room next time. Location was maybe 50 feet from the Chinatown Dragon Gate. Perfect . The staff was friendly and helpful. I loved the toiletries and the bed was amazing. The crowning gem was that when our friend came to pick us up we set 5 bags of various sizes down on the sidewalk before putting them in the car. We each grabbed one or two, commented about where there was more room to stuff things, got in the car and left..leaving one of the bags on the sidewalk. 30 minutes later we got to our next destination only to realize nobody had picked up the last bag. Quick call back to the hotel and they reassured us they had it (with not contact info on it) behind the counter! We'll be back!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Staff. Cleanliness. THE BED! The bathroom and the toiletries
review.locationRemarks: Right next to the Chinatown Dragon Gate. Perfect location to walk to ALL the places we wanted to visit.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: clean place and a good location there are a lot of services around the hotel

review.title: Ideal central location
review.reviewText:
Despite my fears of the location the hotel these were soon disregarded when almost everything was close to hand, shopping, China Town, restaurants, cable car, coit tower etc. even Pier 39 was only a 30 minute walk. 
We parked the car for four days and walked every where, even to collect our bikes for a trip over Golden Gate Bridge. A must do trip, but the bridge itself can be a bit manic with pedestrians and other cyclists all over the place, still worth it though.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the street below (better sound insulated glass required)
review.locationRemarks: The cable car is only a few blocks away. Breakfast at Sears fine dining two blocks away is a great way to start the day as well as Alcatraz & biking.

review.title: In the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to everything. The staff is extremely helpful and responsive. The hotel is clean, quiet and has a nice rooftop garden. I would recommend this place to my friends and family.

review.title: Almost next door to Chinatown!
review.reviewText: Rooms are a little small, but everything is very clean and comfortable. It appears to be relatively new.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was VERY helpful and friendly, and it's location was ideal. Close to trolley stops, Union Square, good restaurants, and Fisherman's Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: Having the restaurant serve dinner.

review.title: San Franciscans can take a lesson
review.reviewText: If all san Franciscans were like Orchard Garden staff, we would have had a better time. Hotel staff were courteous, friendly, exceedingly helpful. In short, everything most San Franciscans were not. Too bad but kudos to the hotle staff and management
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant could be better profiled. It looks a bit like a waiting room.
review.locationRemarks: Spitting dfistance from lower Chinatown. Great shopping and eateries nearby. Good transit available to take you anywhere if you don't want to drive.

review.title: Great central location, near Chinatown
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff, and a great location made this a perfect place to launch our three day exploration of San Fran. Our room was light and comfortable, though not all rooms in this hotel are. The roof terrace was a welcome space for enjoying the morning sun, and to peer down at action on the street, which included a film set on our second day. We didn't bother with breakfast here as there are more interesting places at hand.

review.title: Overpriced for what you get but good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is tired and the rooms all a sickly beige colour. We weren't welcomed at reception nor asked how our stay was at check out. There is a difference between efficiency and customer service. Location is great as it is just outside china town and an short walk to union square. The showers are inadequate and gave no power meaning it takes half an hour to wash shampoo out of your hair. Mini bar was full of rusty water and bed sheets had stains on them. Our room overlooked an aircon machine. Overall we found it expensive for what it was and gave stayed in much better 3,5 star hotels in the US.
review.negativeRemarks: Showers need replacing and given more water pressure to make them usable
review.locationRemarks: Near union square and next to china town

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: I appreciate how the receptionists say hello and bye when we go out or came back to the hotel.  The room is really clean.  The bed is very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the scenery of the view.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate  Bridge.

review.title: Not a good buy for the price
review.reviewText: Orchard Garden has a great location for a touring visitor--especially a foodie-- steps away from French restaurants and Chinatown, walking distance to North Beach. But the hotel's appointments are average to shabby, and service below par from inexperienced or undertrained staff.  For the $400 price, I recently had an amenity location hotel in downtown Los Angeles offering a first-class, all day buffet for members only and an evening full bar, thus saving me and my husband about $150 a day. Try harder, work smarter, Orchard Garden!

review.title: Location location
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, everything you need is all around you.  Use the muni great easy way to get around and is a few minites walk away.

review.title: Great staff..
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Helped us on how to get to places and recommend great dining places. Great boutique hotel in downtown area..

review.title: Great hotel, close to shopping and restaurants
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for a total of five days.  The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly.  Since this hotel is smaller than some of the larger hotels, you get one on one service.  The rooms were clean and very comfortable and we would definitely choose this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to stores like Macy's for shopping and good choice of all kinds of restaurants and cafes.  Also close to buses and trolleys for getting around.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: This is a nice, clean hotel in a safe neighborhood conveniently located close to Chinatown, Union Sq, buses, trains, and trolleys.  Great place to stay.

review.title: Excellent Time in SF
review.reviewText: Lots if things to see in SF if you are there to see the sites. Did the usual things (Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, Sausilito, Golden Gate Park, Ball Game) and was not disappointed with anything. Things are set up quite well to cater to the tourists.  Don't need to rent a car if you are staying in the Downtown area.
review.positiveRemarks: We had a room in more to the back of the building and noise was not an issue at all.  The room was a bit on the small side but that was fine for us.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps main floor restaurant could be open a little longer
review.locationRemarks:
Great Location if you don't mind walking a little bit.  You can easily walk to Fishermans Wharf area or to the Ballpark.
Transit system if very good

review.title: Good hotel close to Union Square and Chinatown
review.reviewText:
We had a good 3 night stay here at the start of a long trip in the US. It's a great base for pretty much anything in SF, we walked quite a lot, or took short cab rides to the Piers. The concierge and reception staff were friendly and knowledgable. Breakfast was well made and presented, with a friendly server. 

The room was a little small and dark, and was overlooked by the office building next door so we would book the next type of room up if we visited again.
review.negativeRemarks: Consistent restaurant opening hours
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square
Chinatown

review.title: Great spot in s great city
review.reviewText: Good staff. Great location. Clean big and comfortable room. Only negative is gym is very average.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Location was ideal (walk to BART, cable car and bus lines) with lots of good restaurants and shopping near by. Room was very quiet and good temperature control. Bed was comfortable, blinds were dark and shower worked well. No complaints! Staff were very helpful. Highly recommend.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, service was nice, big rooms with big bathrooms, very clean place, well located, a lot of things at walking distance. If you go there, you can grab a bit at Café Claude or get a drink at the bar at Gitane, next right to it. Walked from the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf, it's about 30 minutes but that way you can enjoy the city and the life of the Chinese and Italian district you have o go through to get there. Would go back anytime and recommend to a friend without hesitation. The staff is nice and helpful.
Staff was very helpful and friendly, location is excellent, room was very clean and comfortable over all a great hotel for a stay in S.F..

review.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location.
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We are 28-30 yr old couple who enjoy walking to take in the city (even the hills - It's part of the experience)

Hotel:
- Friendly and accommodating staff.
- Nice spacious room with large bathroom.
- Quiet (no street noise and didn't hear anyone in the rooms next door)

Location:
- Short walk Union Square and shopping
- Right on the border of Chinatown
- Easy walk to Ferry Building
- Nice walk to Fishermans Wharf through Chinatown and Italian Disctrict
- ~$15 Taxi to Mission District (16th & Valencia), where you'll find plenty of bars and restaurants.

review.title: The best small hotel I have stayed at.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff. In 30 years of business travel this is one of the three best small hotels I have ever stayed at.
review.positiveRemarks: Their attention to detail, room comfort, and its location.
review.negativeRemarks: The dinner menu.
review.locationRemarks: Ideally located in the center of downtown, close to shopping and business centers. Easy freeway access.

review.reviewText: Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed breakfast at the on-site restaurant.

review.title: Comfortable, quiet and great location
review.reviewText: We loved our room. Comfortable bed, nice furnishings, and quiet. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Loved the location. Definitely would go back.
review.locationRemarks: Just steps away from the China Town entrance gate. Great central location for a fun weekend in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel right next to China Town.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, reasonably priced for downtown SF. Comfortable bed, clean premises and really nice and efficient staff. The concierge there, Art, is superb. Great restaurant recommendations, very helpful with transportation issues. I'd definitely stay there again. My only real criticism is I'd like to see some weights in the hotel fitness room, which is small and limited to some cardio equipment.

review.title: The Orchard is a well located and well run Hotel.
review.reviewText: We had an excellent experience. The Hotel is very well located in downtown San Francisco, an easy walk to Union Square and other interesting things to see. Check in was very easy and our room was very comfortable and clean. The room was not huge, but it had a comfortable sofa, very comfortable bed with nice crisp linens, and the bathroom was well appointed. We will definitely stay there again when our travel takes us to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Close to Union Square shopping and the sights of China Town.

review.title: Convenient location for Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean, close proximity to Market St, Union Square, Chinatown.

review.title: Very small for price
review.reviewText: The room was clean but extremely tiny. No breakfast included with room. For over $500 for 2 nights I expect breakfast. Parking was $45 a day. I just think for the price I could have stayed in a suite somewhere else.

review.title: Good hotel to explore SF
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. The room was clean and quiet at night - even close to the lift.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, clean room. Good wifi. Well located for exploring SF. Ferry terminal, Fishermans wharf, shops, and main bus routes all within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to centre of SF with shops and restaurants. Very good French restaurant across the road for breakfast and dinner. Right by the Chinese quarter.

review.title: Pleasant surprise in SF!
review.reviewText: This was an important one night stay and we were so glad to have found such a nice hotel so close to our activity. The price was midway between the awful hotels and the most expensive, but it was previous reviews that convinced us to book the Orchard Garden.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was so pleasant and helpful. Very clean and inviting lobby, and room.
review.negativeRemarks: The business center printer wasn't working when we arrived, and we had REALLY needed to use it. Even so, the front desk assisted and we got it done!
review.locationRemarks: Right near Union Square, China Town, a nice reasonable public parking garage, and lots of little restaurants. Buses and cable cars, too.

review.title: Well located, perfect for our group.
review.reviewText: reaaly perfect. convenient, within our budget and clean. I was just the kind of place we needed.

review.title: honeymoon stay
review.reviewText:
we were very pleased with the staff, they made our stay warm & friendly, the location was close to tram's & the tube
the hotel rooms were what we were after for our stay in San Francisco,

review.title: Good Location, close to china town & cable car
review.reviewText: Beds are comfortable, good house keeping. Staff are very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Need brighter light bulbs in room, will be better if put one more standing lamp at the other end of the desk.
review.locationRemarks: China town & Fisherman's wharf, union square. Lots of restaurants & shopping nearby.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square and Chinatown and a great hotel

review.title: Superb hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel as it was central and within walking distance to the Moscone. The hotel was extremely clean, well decorated and the staff were wonderful. First time in a while that the hotel and rooms actually look the same if not better than the pictures on Expedia.

If you're looking for a luxurious hotel, in a good location and good value then I would recommend The Orchard Garden hotel. You should also check out the sun rise from the roof top terrace, great views!
review.positiveRemarks: - location - decor - quality of rooms - friendliness of staff
review.negativeRemarks: - cheaper option at the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very central. Close to Union Square, financial district, Yerba Buena and Moscone. Also very close to lots of transport links.

review.title: Excellent Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: Great staff, comfortable rooms, great location. We left valuables in the room and nothing was taken/moved. Standard of cleaning + manners was brilliant, totally worth the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort level, free Wifi and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Tunnel Top bar up the block is great fun if a little loud. There's also the 24 hour "Lori's Diner" nearby which is great any time of day.

review.title: Very well located close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel. We are asked for and were given a quiet room at the back of the hotel. The front is on quite a main road.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, China Town and shops

review.title: Caring & Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel's location was central to everything we wanted to see & do. The Bell Captains were extremely knowledgeable and all the staff were pleasant. The breakfasts were divine. Our room, although smaller than we'd like, was more than functional, with good lighting and mirrors (rare to find these days). Loved the turn down bed and chocolates that awaited us. We especially enjoyed the roof top garden - bonus! And lastly, but most importantly, we appreciated the hotel's focus on preserving the environment and reducing their toxic footprint.
review.negativeRemarks: The television remote proved to be our only challenge!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was centrally located to everything we wanted to see and do.

review.title: Absolutely no complaints!
review.reviewText: Everything was absolutely wonderful. My second time at this hotel and I will do it again! Location, staff, room, facilities, everything you could ask for when traveling, for business or pleasure.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service menu could have a few more options, although the food was actually very good.
review.locationRemarks: Tons to do, starting with Chinatown just half a block away. Union square and shopping. Not too long a walk to Fisherman´s wharf. Excellent

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel based on reviews we read on line. The hotel was nice and clean, good location , professional and friendly stuff . It was a good experience and we will recommend this hotel to our friends
review.positiveRemarks: We like the location, the stuff ,the green initiative
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent, close the China town, shopping, restaurants, easy access from bart

review.title: Great location, great place
review.reviewText: We stayed for a long weekend with friends and had a wonerful time. They took exceptional care of us and helped us with a problem with our booking. We love the location, close to most of the city that we enjoy visiting. We were able to walk to many of our destinations. Very comfortable and clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: No free coffee in the mornings in the lobby, one of the few minuses for this place. Probably cost it the fifth star.
review.locationRemarks: Next door to China town and a short walk from the Ferry Building, Union Square and the Italian section.

review.title: Perfect city centre hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived in the rain but we're greeted by Phil who unloaded our bags as we checked in. The front desk staff were helpful. Our room was a good size and was well appointed,clean and modern. The hotel is in the perfect location to visit Union Square and the Chinatown Gate is literally around the corner. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to centre of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here in January 2014. We had a City View Room which is slightly larger than the standard double. Everything we could wish for was provided and the room was very comfortable - lovely bedding and very comfortable bed. The hotel is very close to all the shops, cable car etc. so is a great base for exploring San Francisco - it's right by the entrance to Chinatown. The staff were courteous and efficient. We'd definitely use this hotel again if we revisit San Francisco. P.S. The doorman told us there is another Orchard Garden nearby - the other one is older and more traditional in styleand has slightly larger rooms but the rooms in this one are brighter.
review.positiveRemarks: Organic toiletries, lovely batroom, bathrobes in City View Room.
review.negativeRemarks: No - all was excellent
review.locationRemarks: It was situated right near Union Square in Bush Street - about 5 minutes from the centre but not right in the centre.

review.title: Decent price, comfortable nights.
review.reviewText:
Staffs are friendly, easy to ask for assistances.
Price was very decent. Only downside was the outside view of window (it was just back alley) but I was aware of that I was supposed to pay more for better view so no big deal.
I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping staffs should check shampoo/bodywash because the bottles were empty for the first night so i had to leave a note to ask for refill.

review.title: Lovely place!
review.reviewText: Not a large place but it had everything. Very quiet location with some Coffee shops and Restrauants close by.

review.title: Great, Eco-friendly hotel
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. Our room was spacious and clean. Staff was friendly and very accommodating. They allowed us to check out a bit later than usual as our 9 month old was still taking a nap when it was time to check out. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to SF.

review.title: Close to China Town and UNion square
review.reviewText: not worth the money. I personally did not enjoy the service and will nt stay at any of the sister chains again. There is nothing that stood out to me for this hotel .... Everything was below average .

The staff was attentive to our needs and responsive when calling for my vehicle. Although the room was small it was well decorated and clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. About the only negative was the view to a rooftop and maintenance/cleaning area. A lower price would make this hotel an excellent value.

review.title: Perfect hotel for a holiday shopping weekend!
review.positiveRemarks: For as close to all the activities and sights of Union Square and Japan Town, once you walk inside the hotel, it's very quiet and peaceful. Great room
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for getting out and about, close to so many great things in the city

review.title: Nice but unexceptional hotel.
review.reviewText: Booked a "junior suite" for my wife's birthday. Large bathroom, large balcony with a view, but small room for the price (about $285 pretax). Staff was great and helpful. Location excellent, literally at the foot of Chinatown and near Union Square, financial district, etc. Valet parking overpriced at $40, with garages nearby.

review.title: What a gem!
review.reviewText: I travel a lot for work, and I have to say the Orchard Garden Hotel in San Francisco is absolutely the best place I've ever stayed at. The room was exceptional - on the 10th floor, with a large bathroom that featured a stand-alone glass shower, and beautiful views of the SF skyline. The real key to Orchard Garden though are the staff. I've never met a friendlier, more eager-to-please group of people. Doorman Alfonso was particularly exceptional and always went out of his way to make our stay there as comfortable as possible. Housekeeping kept our room tidy no matter how late in the day it was before we left the room. I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. If you're going to SF, stay in Orchard Garden!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing! Everything was wonderful.
