review.locationRemarks: The hotel is just a few doors down from the gate to Chinatown. It's also only blocks from Union Square. There's a lot to do within walking distance.

review.title: excellent hotel in the city
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 4 nights, 2 adults with 2 teenage children. Room was excellent, modern and comfortable. Excellent staff and service. If you drive and want to avoid the $45 valet, you can park just 5 minutes away at the public parking, open 24 hours.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to union square, china town, ferry building and fisherman wharf

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at this hotel in SF for 4 nights. Very comfortable hotel. Only disappointment was the breakfast waiter, despite a very good breakfast. I only wish he could be more enthusiastic and smiling to customers. Apart from that, a very good experience. I would come back to this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Enthusiasm of some of the staff
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Embarcadero / Pier 39...

review.title: Nice hotel, very friendly staff
review.reviewText: I had a great time staying in town for 3 days for a marathon event. The room was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly. Great location too, next to ChinaTown and close to shopping & union square. I would return to this hotel for sure!
review.positiveRemarks: Comforatable bed, room was spacious, staff were great!
review.negativeRemarks: I would add a hot tub!

review.title: Great location and excellent value for money
review.reviewText: This has been a lovely place to stay whilst in SF for a mixture of work and pleasure. Location is absolutely perfect; right in the heart of downtown next to shops and restaurants. The hotel staff were very friendly and the hotel had a fairly homely atmosphere. Free wifi in your room a definite plus. Would highly recommend this hotel and we would definitely use it again when in SF
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of shops and restaurants: China town, shopping district and market street, union square

review.title: Very nice hotel close to China Town
review.reviewText: Very clean and eco-friendly hotel situated right at the gates to China Town in the Financial District. Very easy walk to the Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, and the Moscone Center.
review.positiveRemarks: If the weather permits, take the time to have a cocktail on the rooftop garden. Absolutely beautiful!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent restaurants nearby - Plouf, Cafe Tiramisu, and B44, or just grab a drink at Murphy's Pub, Le Central, or Cafe de la Presse.

review.title: Perfect downtown location.
review.reviewText: This was a return visit to this hotel. The location is well located to Union Square and the financial district. Easy walk to public transportation and shopping. A few blocks from the f-line trolley that will take you anywhere from Castro to Hyde street on the wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Very quiet and subdued with pleasant exceptionally courteous staff. Adult ambience.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee service in room could be better. (one cup at a time, but Good) Starbucks across the street. Wi-Fi is good but HD on TV would be a nice touch.
review.locationRemarks: At the Chinatown gate. (Grant and Bush Streets) Pretty close to everything.

review.title: Great location near Union Square and Chinatown
review.reviewText: We appreciated that this hotel was LEED certified. The staff was particularly pleasant and helpful. The room was large and well appointed.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping in Union Square, great restaurants, Chinatown just out the door.

review.title: Hotel just as previous reviewers stated.....
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel after reading many, many reviews at the Expedia website. We were not disappointed! We arrived early in the morning and left our bags and started our sightseeing right away. Our room was comfortable and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the concierge, Phil. He helped us get to Oakland easily despite the BART strike! We spent four nights and would gladly stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect - so much within walking distance. For being on a busy street, it was surprisingly quiet!
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure changes a bit during showers, but there's no simple solution for that!
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Financial District, Union Square...even Fisherman's Wharf are walkable. So many wonderful restaurants nearby as well! Great location!

review.title: Ideal location, Excellent hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed here at the end of September for 8 nights. All hotel staff were welcoming and friendly throughout our stay. Hotel was well kept and cleanliness was of a high standard. Location is downtown and is very central for all sights which were all within easy walking distance. A nice addition is the roof top terrace where we sat one evening and enjoyed a bottle of wine in the moonlight.

review.title: Favorite SF hotel
review.reviewText: This is always my first choice hotel in SF. Love it - perfect location, quiet, central, and uber clean. Also highly energy efficient, which is a bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, beautiful rooms, always spotlessly clean.
review.negativeRemarks: A little more sound proofing btwn rooms with a shared door.
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping, financial district, Chinatown, etc.

review.title: Good situation but poor service
review.reviewText: The shower in our room was poor and after 3 attempts by maintenance staff we were left with a shower head not attached to the wall!!! Reception staff apologised but did not check on work done, although as we were returning to the hotel 3 days later, we were given upgraded rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance staff
review.locationRemarks: Next to China Town, 20 minute walk to Pier 39 and10 minutes to shops

review.title: Not at your service!
review.reviewText: At check in no one offered to help with bags. Sunday morning needed our car by 10:30. Started calling at 10a.m. Called x1650 as instructed, no answer. Called "0" no answer. Called bell staff...no answer. Called Valet and Front Desk...no answer, after several attempts. Had to walk down to request the car be brought from garage. Twenty minutes later when we came down to check out and leave...car was not there. Manager had to go get it and it finally arrived at 10:55...nearly an hour to get a car! We were late to our brunch meeting. There is NO service in this hotel. For the price I expected better.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very comfortable room with nice soft beds. Staff was very nice and extremely helpful. Next to Chinatown and Union Square. Easy to catch the F train to Fisherman's Warf. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend staying here.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown and Union Square. Lot of restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: No City View!!!!
review.reviewText: They call starring into the wall of the hotel next door "a city view". This place is a joke. Save your money!

review.title: EXCELLENT LOCATION
review.reviewText: WE STAYED ON THE TOP FLOOR LEVEL 10 EXCELLENT LOCATION VERY QUITE ROOM BEST BREAKFAST IN 3 WEEKS OF TRAVELING OUR ROOM WAS CLEANED EVERY DAY WITH BED TURN DOWN AT NIGHT VERY GOOD STAFF COULD NOT DO ENOUGH FOR YOU PLENTY OF ADVISE ON WERE TO SHOP AND SIGHTS TO SEE RIGHT NEXT DOOR TO CHINA TOWN GATE AND A 10 MIN WALK TO LITTLE ITALY BEST EATING EVER THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL STAY
review.negativeRemarks: MAYBE SELF SERV TEA MAKING IN LOBBY
review.locationRemarks: EXCELLENT LOCATION 5 MIN TO MACYS AND GREAT SHOPPING DISTRICT LUNCH AND DINNER ACROSS THE ROAD STARBUCKS ON CORNER

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Really nice staff, free internet access and a short walk from a BART station means you can get from the airport for only $8.25 (get a ticket for and get off at Montgomery St - it's a synch).

Plenty of eateries, bus tours and booked all excursions from hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Very pleasant rooms, non-cheesy décor and a real good-sized bathroom. Add this to its location and it's a real winner.
review.negativeRemarks: Watch out for the freebies in the room - THEY'RE NOT!!! Chambermaids restocked on crisps, biscuits and I didn't realise I'd be charged for these.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square with all the (fancy) shops, cable cars and is virtually next door to Chinatown. Pier 39 within walking distance (20 mins)

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very central convenient location and very helpful and friendly stall
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square and Chinatown

review.title: Expensive but good location
review.reviewText:
Thought the room was overpriced but talking to other travellers, this was the case for most hotels in San Francisco. Booked a superior city view room but view from 7th floor wasn't brilliant.
Location is fantastic, close to Metro stop, next to Chinatown and on route for the site seeng buses.
Did not use hotel restaurant as there are plenty of places nearby to have breakfast, lunch & dinner.
If you get stuck, Macy's near Union Sq has a good food court and also their Westfield Mall (just behind Macy's) has a good choice in their food court.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Quiet but if you enjoying interacting with other guest this may not be for you as we hardly saw other guests. Free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could do with an update. Slightly old fashioned (by European standards) but were extremely clean.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is next door. Walk to Union Sq is 5-7 mins. Walk to Fisherman's Wharf is 15-20 mins. Metro was cheap & easy to use to & from airport.

review.title: Great for a short stay in SF
review.reviewText: My husband and I just spent 3 nights in downtown San Francisco at the Orchard Garden. I'm glad we chose this hotel. It's very central to Union Square, shopping, Chinatown and the North Beach neighborhood with lots of great restaurants. The rooms were spotlessly clean - the place looks brand new. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The free wifi was great also. Our room didn't have much of a view but we didn't mind - it was quiet, and unlike a lot of other properties in SF, it had central air conditioning (much needed during our stay). I got a great nights sleep all three nights. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, clean, new, comfortable, friendly staff, free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping, restaurants and sightseeing within walking distance

review.title: Great location, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, quiet hotel in a central location to shopping, sight-seeing and dining. The staff were helpful and accommodating. Easy to walk everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean, comfortable & quiet. The hotel has taken steps to be environmentally friendly. Great location & helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps they could offer a complimentary breakfast - the dining room seemed underused. The wifi connection was slow.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in a great central location - close to Chinatown, a short walk to shopping at Westfield Centre & Union Square, cable cars, & the F-line.

review.title: Very nice Hotel. The location is super centric. :
review.reviewText: The hotel is next to the Chinese market entrance. Super silent and perfect place for shopping back and forth. I would stay in this hotel on my next trip. The hotel is next to the Chinese market entrance. Super silent and perfect place for shopping back and forth. I would stay in this hotel on my next trip. The hotel is next to the Chinese market entrance. Super silent and perfect place for shopping back and forth. I would stay in this hotel on my next trip.

review.title: Business Trip
review.reviewText:
Was not very happy at all with this hotel. First of all...I order a $14.00 continental breakfast from room service. When the meal and bill came, it was $30! There was a $5.00 Delivery Fee (I was on the 2nd floor), and a $4.60 Service Fee!!!!! After calling the manager, i was told the service fee was the gratuity that is automatically added to your bill. That's a 33% tip. There was no note on the menu either specifying that gratuity is included. They hotel manager told me they would remove this charge. Upon check out, the charge was NOT removed AND to add insult to injury, I was charged a $1.00 Fee for using their telephone to call the HOTEL about bogus charges. You can image my disgust. How many people overlook these small charges and this hotel is just robbing people! I don't understand how they continue this practice.

In addition, no snack/soda vending machines on premises, but they do offer $3.00 12 oz sodas in your room bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Bogus charges!

review.title: Clean, modern and good location.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is quite new, so rooms are new, good condition, and comfortable. I didn't really interact with the staff except check-in and check-out, and they were nice. I didn't eat there, as it is close to all public transportation (subway, bus, rail), it is easy to go to different restaurants.
The only problem is the Internet. It is free but the bandwidth seems to be a problem. Simple search to lookup directions was quite ok, but couldn't watch and video, it consistently time out.
review.negativeRemarks: The Internet definitely needs improvement, the air conditioner was a little noisy.
review.locationRemarks: It is right next to the entrance to Chinatown, walking distance to MOMA, and other museums. Walking distance to cable car and a lot of shopping.

review.title: Stay at Orchard Garden
review.reviewText: Great hospitality, friendly staff, safe environment, and
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to many touristic points and quiet neighbourhood
review.negativeRemarks: Internet speed
review.locationRemarks: Access to Union square, China town, Cable car, shopping, coffee shops, and restaurant

review.title: Right next door to China gate!
review.reviewText: Staff was polite and prompt, room was quiet and clean. would stay there again.

review.title: Comfortable & central for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText: We arrived late but were welcomed and quickly given a room. Very quiet and comfortable. The hotel provided the perfect base for visiting and enjoying San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Visit Alcatraz, take tram, bike rental to cycle to the Golden Gate Bridge. Haight neighbourhood and into Golden Gate park. Lori's diner up road.

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to Chinatown
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was nice and clean. We had no issues during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooftop patio a nice place to enjoy morning coffee and take-in the city view.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a little small, but OK for a hotel room in the city. Parking somewhat of a hassle and expensive.

review.title: Central hotel good for tourists
review.reviewText:
We stayed here as a family of four. The hotel is centrally located, so easy to get around. The rooms are on the small side (but this is normal for city hotels). The bathroom was a good size. As we were four people, the beds were double and therefore a bit on the small side for two people to share. There is no movie service in the room. There was a DVD player but the DVD collection from reception is very limited with mostly old films. In this day and age, who use DVDs anymore? Our DVD player was broken so we had to get it replaced as our kids wanted to watch a movie. They replaced it the following morning.

If you travel on business, this hotel is no good if you need decent internet connection. We tried to use the connection to book tickets at six flags online, but we could not get onto the site to book via our laptops. We tried using the business centre but their PCs were unacceptably old with an internet connection so slow it would be more interesting to watch paint dry.

The restaurant downstairs looked rather uninspiring, so we opted to eat elsewhere. As far as I could tell, very few people had food there. There was a small roof terrace which looked fine, but no service of drinks available.

The guy on the door who met us on arrival was very friendly and helpful - he made our arrival very welcoming!

Parking was $40 + tax per night (valet with in/our option). Expensive, but you are in the middle of San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and central. The door guy was exceptionally friendly (were arrived on 20 August for 2 nights)!
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access and so-called business centre. High speed internet with current PCs is a must these days and this is not available at this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and China Town, and business area.

review.title: Convenient hotel but not a pretty street.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but as a city boutique hotel I expected a bit more for our money. Dreadful shower and hair dryer - both barely functioning. In a good location for union square, China town and walkable to the Pier area.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower
review.locationRemarks: Bit run down

review.title: Getting what you pay for
review.reviewText: You do not get what you pay for rooms were small, no water pressure, beds were uncomfortable,and my view was terrible I will never stay at this hotel again
review.negativeRemarks: Rates and the overall comfort of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: I've been and stayed in a lot of big cities were this hotel was located was way over crowded no where to park so you had to wslk everywhere

review.title: OK Business Hotel - but pricey.
review.reviewText:
A pleasant, clean, well run small "business person's" hotel in the market district next to entrance to China Town. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are a bit cramped and could do with a bit more practical storage (drawers would be nice). Rooms are tastefully furnished modern and generally in good condition.

My only gripes are: -
1) the room rate - way too high - this is not a 5 star establishment - its a good 3 Star bordering on 4. and
2) Breakfast costs $14 for a coffee and cereal - rip-off !!! Breakfast should be included in the rate as they charge top dollar for the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Over priced rooms and grossly over-priced breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Market District near China Town

review.title: Good location but limited amenities.
review.reviewText: Our room was lovely and the location was excellent. the staff was not very knowledgable or helpful with restaurant recommendations, parking, valet, or sites. Even though the site says it has a fitness center it is not really, with only 3 cardio machines. the fee to go to a real fitness center was 15$ per person! there were 4 of us! so not too happy.
review.positiveRemarks: its clean and modern and located right next to china town
review.negativeRemarks: get a real fitness center or sign an agreement for complimentary use. train the staff on parking and restaurants and sites.
review.locationRemarks: close to china town and to union square and financial district. walking distance to trolleys and then to fisherman's wharf if you take the trolley.

review.title: Two nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located in San Fancisco and a good sized hotel; you don't get lost in it's size. The staff is fantastic . The bar is small and intimate and easy to strike up a conversation. Go see Tina the bar tender and have her tell you about her designs!
review.positiveRemarks: the size of the hotel, the location, and the bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is centrally located which makes it easy to walk in all directions. The Italian restuarant down a near by alley was fantastic.

review.title: Proper gem of a hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText:
This is an absolutely fantastic hotel and I would definitely stay there again if I return to San Francisco.

I was initially shocked at the cost of hotels in San Francisco - accommodation appears to be expensive all over and I was there in July. Once I got over this, I started searching for the bargains. I'm moderately fussy and wanted to stay quite centrally but a few blocks away from the major attractions. Orchard Garden seemed to fit the bill and looking through other reviews made up my mind.

I was made very welcome on arrival (and received warm greetings as I departed) and was able to check in at 11 despite not having requested early check-in ahead of time. The room was spotless and well presented, and incredibly quiet. I had requested a room on the upper floors at the back so it would be quieter, but I imagine most rooms would be quiet as they are all double-glazed and the doors are thick.

The location is great - about 20 yards from the Dragon Gate of Chinatown - so you could be at Union Square in 10 minutes, on the BART in 5 and at Embarcadero in under 15. I walk everywhere and got up to Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf within 45 minutes, so you really have all the major tourist attractions close by.

On a general SF note, use your feet. There's little need to talk BART or Muni unless you have mobility problems. SF is beautiful to walk around (just avoid Tenderloin) and there really is plenty to see on the streets.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was so quiet and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey, but then everywhere in SF during summer is expensive.

Next time we'll stay somewhere else that has more to offer.

We did not get a chance to use the gym facilities.It was good to know it was there if you felt like .
The free wifi was an absolute positive.

review.title: Superb facility, compassionate staff
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a small eco-friendly hotel, right near the Chinatown gate. Excellent location, with lots of restaurants nearby, easy walk to every, and public transit aplenty nearby. Room was small, but exceptionally well-laid out. Bathroom was large and everything worked well.

The staff were perhaps the best I have had in a hotel in some years. Upon arriving to SF, I learned that my mom had died. I informed the staff on check in and the promised to work with me in order for me to leave early. They bought a small box of truffles to my room later that evening. All around excellent people.

I would hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: Greate for a business or romantic stay
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel while attending a meeting at Moscone center for a few days. The hotel is located a stone-throw away from the Chinatown gate at Grant and Bush streets. It is about 3 blocks from Moscone center and has a ton of very nice/cheap places to eat (e.g. Banana Thai, Ramen Underground) within a block distance and great coffee within walking distance (e.g. Coffee Bar on Bush and Montgomery, Blue Bottle closeby). The hotel itself is very nice. The surrounding area is typical of a financial area that is rather dead at night and not very nice to look at, reasonably clean, etc. Some people used to quiet areas might feel a bit uneasy walking to the hotel at night but I felt perfectly safe. My friends from Paris, Amsterdam, London, NYC, and Nashville all felt ok walking around but a friend from a small town in the northeast did not. Other than that, great room, decent price, good service. They kept my bags until I had to head to the airport. The doorman found a cab while I sat and drank iced water on their waiting area. Free WIFI that doesn't suck (I could skype w my family abroad). If this hotel was located across market street it would easily command a price twice as expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: The location is not picturesque, if you want a hotel with beautiful surroundings this is not it. This is as urban as it gets (not unsafe though)

But it was more than made up for by the friendly and helpful staff. However, the staff seemed to be short handed at times...there was no one available at the front desk during the normal business hours. The Roots restaurant seemed hardly to be in business. The only time we ate there was in the morning for breakfast which we enjoyed. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. It is a good value for the money. Will definitely recommend to our friends.

review.title: Very Nice SF Hotel
review.reviewText:
Chose this hotel as a combination of location and cost, on the basis of Expedia and Trip Advisor reviews.. The room rate was reasonable (in the extravagant SF frame of reference!) Facilities included access to business equipment (computers/printer) and a small workout room with treadmills. I had qualms about the hotel's "green" emphasis, but this was unfounded. Shower was not underpressured, and I actually loved their cardboard and wood pens!

The room TV was small for my taste, but wouldn't matter to most, I suppose. Room service breakfast on our last day was prompt and tasty. Roof garden was meh, and views from rooms are nonexistent, but in SF you shouldn't be sightseeing from your room anyway.

I would definitely stay at this hotel for any return trip to SF.

review.title: What we expected.
review.reviewText: We drove in so we didn't love the $40 parking, but it's to be expected in downtwon SF. The hotel was fine. Just what we expected. It's supposed to be a "green" hotel, but it occurred to me that they could likely be a little greener if they didn't keep the entire place at what felt like 62 degrees. We did not eat in the restaurant and I didn't see anyone else in there. Likely it was too cold for anyone to give it a try. The room was clean and the staff was great. Room service stops at 10:00 pm. Some downsides, but very clean and very convenient to Chinatown and Union Square. No Concierge. Small lobby and medium sized room. Fairly small bathroom but adequate. A great downtown SF hotel for the price.

review.title: Equally pleased for a second visit!
review.reviewText:
Our first visit a t the Orchard Garden Hotel was in November 2011, when we came for the 49er vs Giants football game. We were very pleased with the hotel, accomodations and the staff. The hotel is very well maintained, the staff is very pleasant and accomodating and the hotel itself is centrally located, so you can walk or us public transportation to go anyway. I might add that this hotel is designated as a eco friendly hotel and GREEN!
This past weekend we were in San Francisco again and of course wanted to stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel again. We were equally impressed and please again with everything.
We highly recommend the Orchard Garden Hotel to anyone.

review.title: Beautiful, newer hotel.
review.reviewText: As quirky and fun as the older hotels can be, it is so nice to stay in a beautiful newer hotel. The staff, from the doorman to the maids, are very friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was larger than most we've had. The location is ideal, right at the Chinatown gate. There are a number of restaurants within two blocks, plus one in the hotel. Best of all, it is extremely quiet, so even with the St. Pat's revelry outside, we didn't hear a peep. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very quiet and ideally located.

review.title: Clean hotel, Great location, and FREE WIFI!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great, especially for the price. Don't expect all the amenities of a big hotel chain though. The room was clean, a bit tight (but its the city, so its expected), huge bathroom (which I love and need more than a large bedroom), and FREE WIFI. We had a bad view, but did not care since we didn't spend much time in the room. This hotel would be bad for children, its a very small hotel (small lobby, small restaurant, narrow hallways) and you can hear outside the room a bit (the walls to the hallway were a little thin). Even though the restaurant and bar was small, it was still a great place to grab a drink or snack before going out to dinner. Drinks were good and the one dish I tried was really yummy and fresh. The bartender was great, knew her stuff and remembered what we liked to drink. The whole staff is really nice, always greeting you and saying to have a good day/night on your way out. Also the location is BRILLIANT! Walking distance from the Financial District and Union Square but without all the touristy crowds and noise. Also it borders the entrance to China Town, which was great if you need to run out quick for souvenirs or snacks. There is a Starbucks less than a block in each direction and bus stops are between 2-5 blocks way depending on where you are headed. And you are literally surrounded by restaurants. Overall, my boyfriend and I had a great stay here and the hotel reached all of our high expectations!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, big bathroom, free wifi, location, bar
review.negativeRemarks: bad views, tight bedroom, small storage space (for unpacking clothes)
review.locationRemarks: AMAZING! surrounded by restaurants, China Town is a jump away, buses 2-5 blocks away, not too many crowds

review.title: Wonderful in every way.location, comfort, staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location for walking to Union Square, the Financial District, and steps away from Chinatown gates and few blocks to North beach. Took Bart from airport to Montgomery and then easy walk to hotel. Nice, fresh, clean room...not spacious but just perfect for 2 adults and 9 yr old. Excellent staff with Ruby at front desk, Art at front door and even housekeeping. Hunan Homes is inexpensive Chinese on Jackson St and great burger place hole in wall called Pearls on Post St. Hotel has a happy hour special in the afternoon which is nice way to relax a bit before going out. Definitely a hotel we would visit again. Enjoyed the intimacy rather than chain large hotel. Recommend booking one of the city tours or Muir woods for first timers Super sightseeing was ours and it was excellent. Included hotel pickup. Great for,us since it rained every day
review.positiveRemarks: Fresh and clean rooms and perfect location. Not glitzy but quite comfortable. Friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything!

review.title: Clean, fashionable and eco-friendly.
review.reviewText: Clean rooms with great decor. The staff was very supportive of us - a"naive tourist" couple on our first trip to San Francisco. Concierge booked some of our tours and was patient in answering our questions. The eco-focus showed through everything. Yes, the bathroom doors are a sliding panel vs. a typical closing door but I'm not sure why everyone makes such a big deal about it on the review sites. I thought it was rather cool and one less thing for me to run into in the darkness. I loved the location - real close to Chinatown, municipal transport and even the famous trolleys. I will go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and fashionable. Close to Chinatown and all public transport!

review.title: Centrally located, would stay again..
review.reviewText:
A great hotel, centrally located, very clean and fresh. Staff were very helpful. I would definitely stay again!

Rhonda
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: handy to chinatwon, Fishermans Wharf. Very close to the bars and shopping of Union Square

review.title: nearly perfect.
review.reviewText: great location and great hotel , but theres only one complain about the room,THE AIR CON,told the lady on the front desk twice but nothing was done,that was the only downside,warm room.
review.negativeRemarks: air con
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Clean, comfy, green!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Green. The most comfortable bed I've slept on in a hotel. Staff very friendly. 5 minutes walk from Montgomery Bart. Next to the entrance of China town. 5 minutes from Union Square and trolley. Eat at Nanking on Kearney. Best sizzling rice soup and green tea ever. Also Le Colonial on Taylor and I don't remember. French, vietnamese, fancy, and fabulous! Don't forget gelato, somewhere!! Skip pier 39. Will return with kids!!

review.title: Orchard Garden Hotel San Fran
review.reviewText: We had a lovely time in San Francisco. The Orchard Garden Hotel was clean and well located very close to China Town. We enjoyed a really nice caffe opposite for breakfast. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and recommended some really nice restaurants. A lovely team who helped to make our stay a memorable one.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and their polite and friendly attitude. Nothing seemed too much effort.
review.negativeRemarks: The room did not have a nice view.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal.

review.title: Happy
review.reviewText: The staff was awesome... very friendly and very helpful. I'd stay here again!

review.title: Loved thed Orchard Garden Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was centrally located near the China Town gates. It was close to restaurants, shopping and easy access to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant menu was very limited.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great!!! It was close to restaurants and transportation.

review.title: Lifts not working, and little apology.
review.reviewText:
When we arrived at the hotel for a 4 night stay, we were advised the lifts were not working, so had to take all our bags up the stairs. We were assured by the staff they would be fixed that night.
3 nights later they were still dead. So we were forced to use the stairs constantly. Being up 8 floors, this was NOT a nice thing.
Finally, on day 4 they fixed them. Late the day before we left
What was disappointing was not the lift themselves, but the repeated assurance they were "fixing them" when they weren't, and the minimum apology on their being out of action.
Especially when nothing was offered to compensate us for the inconvenience.

Would I stay there again?
Hard to say. Not a bad location, price was OK, but not for a hotel where the lifts weren't working. So, probably not. I'd look around first.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing particularly. It was a hotel. No better than many others I stay at.
review.negativeRemarks: Lift was broken most of our stay
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to everything, located near Chinaown gates.

review.title: Best SF value, quiet street just off Union Square
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel located three blocks from Union Square. Very quiet street, quiet, clean hotel with really comfortable beds and duvets. Nice towels for a great shower. Granite countertop, spacious bathroom. Wall mounted large TV with a sitting chair and table. Out of all the hotels I've stayed in within the SF area, and there have been many over the years, this is my favorite. Even the price beats any other hotel for what you get. Parking was cheaper and bell hope sweet and accomodating.
review.negativeRemarks: No free breakfast, but Starbucks on both corners!
review.locationRemarks: Exceptional, a few blocks (safe) walk from Union Square

review.title: Pleasant Hotel, good Location
review.reviewText:
Orchard Garden Hotel is just a few steps to the entry of China Town and within easy walking distance to the shopping area near Union Square and the Powell Street Trolley Car. It is quiet and well situated. Staff are helpful and polite. There are a variety of restaurants close by to suit any taste. Free internet is available in the room and if you need to print anything the business centre can be used for this purpose. The only thing that was a little annoying was that there were no facilities for doing laundry in the hotel and sending laundry out could prove a little expensive. The only other alternative was a laundry up the street which only takes $5 in quarters!
All in all though, the hotel experience was a very positive one. Would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square
Powell Street Trolley Car
China Town
Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Love this Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a hidden gem! It is super clean, the workers are extremely courteous and nice and the room is very very. It is also near Union Square and Chinatown which is a great location!
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square

review.title: go green, and enjoy!
review.reviewText: Super impressed with this eco friendly hotel...rooms are clean, comfortable, and lights are operated with your room key (they turn off when you leave). staff was super friendly and definitely knew me by sight at the end of the trip. Would recommend it to anyone!

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Small room but neat and tidy. Good location for tourist. Staffs are all very friendly, informative nad helpful. A lot of good eating places nearby. Will definitely recommend R&G lounge but need to book on weekend if looking for a good, cheap and authentic Chinese food. If limited by time, will suggest do the hop on hop off bus tour around San Franscisco. There is a stop just across from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Will recommend Chinatown, Golden Gate Bridge and Lambard Street. Fisherman Warf is good for seafood but otherwise a bit over-rated as tourist attractions. A good way to see San Fransisco is going on an open top hop on and hop off tour bus.

review.title: Downtown location with character
review.reviewText: This place is a gem. Convenient downtown hotel recently completely renovated and energy efficient. Five blocks from BART station. Rooms are modern and comfortable. The smaller size of this hotel eliminates the impersonal nature of most downtown properties. Staff are friendly and helpful. It is a downtown hotel and in a high density, busy area. Best for travelers not dependent on their own personal vehicle. Hotel is a half block from Chinatown. Only downside is that this place will become known and supply / demand will kick in.

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel because of its great location - it is very easy to walk around the city to Union Square, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are nothing special - ours overlooked a dumpster - but the hotel is very clean and quiet and the service is very good.

review.title: Truly pleased!!!
review.reviewText:
What a wonderful surprise! A beautiful hotel. Wonderful bed and linens. The entire hotel was spotless and had everything that we needed. Stay here, you will not be disappointed. BTW it is California's first eco-friendly hotel inside and out. Easy walk to Market, Financial District, Chinatown and Union Square.

It was a perfect!

review.title: Too pricy without green charm
review.reviewText: Did not meet expectations for green or atmosphere for small boutiqu hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are stylishly done and very spacious. It is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in. I look forward to going back.

review.title: Great Boutique Property in Downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: This was a beautiful, recently remodeled property in an ideal location with great rates compared to nearby chains. The service was outstanding. What a great value and experience!

review.title: Great find
review.reviewText: Our first time to stay here. All personnel we came in contact with were helpful and pleasant. Our room was close to the elevator but was very quiet. The bathroom was spacious. We had a room with a king bed. The bed was very comfortable. The wall mounted flat screen TV was over a wall length built in desk. Drawers on one side and small refrigerator on the other provided plenty of space. The trash receptacle was divided for recycling. I will return and stay here again

review.title: Great location a bit pricey though
review.reviewText: Great location next to china town easy access to union square & short cable car trip to fishermans wharf & pier 39. Starbucks close and plenty of nearby eateries.

review.title: Excellent option
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable beds, friendly staff. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great stay, right in front of china town gate!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel by quickly skim through the reviews because I didn't have time to prepare for the trip so I didn't really expect much. I booked two rooms and they were great, the beds were very soft and clean. My bathroom is also very spacious. The other room has smaller bathroom, but with a sofa. The staff at the hotel was also very helpful in explaining the direction to me several times during my two night stay, and assisting my parents, who do not speak English. The location was impressive, just a little walk from union square with a bit of uphill. Overall, very happy with the place, worth paying for :)

review.title: ok, but not impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed there 3 nights. the loacation is great, right next to china town and easy walking distance to Market street and other tourist places. However I stayed another night a few days later (after a road trip) in a different hotel for less money and with better quality.

review.title: Great service. Small room. Good location
review.reviewText:
GF and I stayed here on a week long Nor Cal trip. The hotel is situated on the edge of Chinatown in the Financial District. Good location for access to public transportation to see the sites. The service was great, however, the housekeeping broke one of the wine glasses we picked up at a Napa vineyard. They didn't notify us, they just left a replacement glass from the restaurant. Very strange. When we complained, the guest services gave us a ~$20 bottle of wine. Reasonable trade given the broken glass was a souvenir. Although, the hotel probably should've been more forthright about the incident.

The rooms are clean with new furniture. Our room was quite dark, even in the daytime. Not a big deal, since we were out seeing the sights most of the time. The room is also quite small ~350 SF. Nothing grand.

All in all, a very nice hotel. Great service for a big city hotel. We would stay there again for sure.

review.title: Great hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
I had a 5 night stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. The room was very clean and bright with free wi-fi and daily newspaper. Everything is in walking distance, especially Chinatown which is huge and just around the corner - it's busy during the day but strangely very quiet in the evenings. You can walk through Chinatown to get to Little Italy and right to Fisherman's Wharf. Go to Pier 39 for the eating and shopping. The Gharadelli Chocolate Factory is wonderful and if you get one of those tourist guides you can claim 10% discount. The Golden Gate Bridge is a must but if you take a boat make sure you bring a jacket as it gets very cold and windy. You can also hire a bike to cycle across and take the ferry back.

You can walk to almost anywhere so make sure you bring your walking shoes as those hill tops are very steep or take a cable car.

The Cheesecake Factory in Macy's is fun, but try to get there early to save waiting for a table. The Westfield is not that big so don't expect a huge shopping mall. The majority of the high street and designer shops are on Union Square. There's a Walgreens at nearly every block for toiletries, medicines, food and drink etc.

San Francisco is a fun city and you will enjoy it as much as we did!

review.title: Great location with great food and tourism options close by!
review.reviewText:
This place is in a great location, literally across from "Cafe de la Presse" (very good breakfast) and "Le Central" (great dinner). 2 minutes from the Bush Street cable car stop and literally 20 steps away from the Chinatown gate.

The hotel itself is great, clean, friendly and helpful service (we asked for maps, help with cabs and limos, all dealt within minutes and with a smile). Our room was nice, clean and with a very nice bath room. Only gripe is the very overly soft bed, too soft is bad.

Great place if you are in town for tourism!

review.title: Best place to stay!
review.reviewText: This place is awesome! We checked in around midnight, and the street was pretty quiet, and felt safe. Staff was very friendly. Only thing that caught us off guard was the parking. Parking is either valet or in a parking garage a short block away. We chose the parking garage and left our car there the whole weekend! (garage seemed secure) The hotel within walking distance to EVERYTHING! Downtown, Union Square, China Town, and the trolley lines that take you down to Fisherman's Warf. Rooms are upscale, and mini bar is very well stocked. We waited last minute to book, so we got a last minute deal. I'd pay full price if I were to go again! Highly recommend!

review.title: Convenient Location - Good Value
review.reviewText: Was in town for a tradeshow and found to hotel to be perfect walking distance to Moscone. The hotel is right at the gates to Chinatown which is perfect for walking in that area and easy to walk to the Wharf, Coit Tower, Little Italy, Washington Park, etc. If you don't like walking hills, dismiss my previous comment but for people who enjoy walking this location is great. We even walked home at night after a Giants game and felt completely safe. There's a great French restaurant across the street. The waiter told us that Tony Bennett had just been there that day for lunch. Very close to great shopping too. The Fitness Center is small - 3 pieces of equipment and no free weights. Internet access was included in price which is a nice plus. Room service was pretty good too. Could have used firmer pillows - the ones we had offered no support so I stuffed the pillowcase with one of the decorative throw pillows instead.

review.title: Great, but needs some improvement.
review.reviewText: Excellent location and truly friendly, very willing, helpful people at the front desk. Some shortcomings: the internet connection was down for most of the time I was there (in the business services room); the room I was in was beside the stairway door which is very heavy and loud when it closes; and my bath was not fully cleaned. Still, there is a very pleasant feel to the place and I'm sure if I had asked for another room they would have moved me. I would return but they should realize there is some room for improvement.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean and modern hotel. Most comfortable bed I ever slept in!

review.title: Upscale private label hotel
review.reviewText: Visitors are in for a pleasant experience. Rooms are very comfortable. Restaurant is convenient, with good food, but is a bit pricey. Internet access is complimentary. Parking overnight costs $40 plus an extra 15% for taxes, but this is not unexpected in San Francisco. This hotel is one of my favorites when I need to stay overnight in San Francisco.

review.title: Good Hotel for Good Price
review.reviewText: Hotel is a small, quaint nice place in a great location of SF. Minutes from Union Square. Rooms are well kept and clean. Staff was very helpful. For a downtown hotel of that class in one of Americas nicest cities it came at a reasonable price .

review.title: I'll go back sometimes in business but not with families.
review.reviewText: Really good location for business travel.

review.title: SFO Business Traveler
review.reviewText: Booked hotel to be close to work. Enjoyed room, free dvds with player, fast internet, excellent restaurant with great food and service. Small intimate bar with unique drinks.

review.title: Very good place to stay!
review.reviewText: The room was clean, comfortable and quiet; a good value at the Expedia price. Had we paid full price we would have objected to the view overlooking the alley and dumpsters. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The location is great (especially being only half a block from the most reasonably priced parking garage in the neighborhood): it's a short walk to Union Square & the Financial District.

review.title: Great for a weekend get a way!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I made the trip to San Fransisco to go watch a 49ers game. We booked the hotel last minute and weren't quite sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised with the location and quality of the Orchid Garden. While on first inspection we thought the room was rather small, it actually suited our needs just fine. It was clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. If your visiting for a long trip a bigger hotel may be what you need, but for a short stay this would be the perfect hotel!

review.title: A comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I like this hotel as the receptionist is very cheerful. The room is spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathing products are of good qulaities. The food of the hotel restaurant also of good standard.

review.title: Perfect for me...
review.reviewText: I am almost sorry to do this but this hotel rocks: clean, well appointed, quiet. But I did find this hotel on Expedia and it is only fair to share this with others. I like staying in nice hotels but personally do not like people greeting me, opening doors, etc so I try to avoid the highest end hotels. This hotel was in that sweet spot - perfect room but no frills. Great location, would definitely use this hotel again.

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel. Clean, fresh and modern yet also inviting and very comfortable! I loved this place and intend to return. My stay was a one-night business visit, so I didn't spend a great deal of time, but staff was helpful and prompt. My car was valet parked and I needed to leave early in the morning, they were able to accommodate my needs with advance notice. The restaurant food was good and convenient. Breakfast was not included in the room, and a little pricey, but a good selection of cold buffet items and Coffee/Teas. I loved the layout of the room. No impersonal "welcome hallway/cattle shuttle" to pass through to get to the room. The door opened directly into the open floor plan of the room. Beautiful.

review.title: Nice, clean & quiet
review.reviewText: We highly recommend a stay at Orchard Garden Hotel. Our room was spacious and very quiet. The location is within walking distance to many attractions. Our only remark is that nearby restaurants and coffee shops closed quite early on weekdays.

review.title: i might try another nearby hotel next time...
review.reviewText: there are a lot more hotels nearby and i like variety.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: Great little hotel. Staff were friendly and welcoming. The room was lovely and clean, bed very comfy. Didn't have a great view, but we weren't expecting to be in the room much. Location is great, near to Union Square and 20 - 30 min walk through Chinatown to Fishermans Wharf. Felt safe walking around the area at night too. 5 minute walk to the main shopping area, Cheesecake Factory well worth a visit. Would stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Looking forward to go back
review.reviewText: Great Hotel and great service!!! Friendly and knowledgable staff. Very clean. Great location...at the center of everything. Hotel had no parking and it was in the center of the city but found a very reasonable parking garage right near hotel. Do not pay for their $40 a day valet parking. Room was very clean with stocked mini bar. Very comfortable bed and very spacious bathroom. View wasn't the greatest but very minor. I highly recommend staying here when visiting San Fran, espceically if a first time visit. Close to all the shops in downtown, all within walking distance. Great eateries in the area as well. Will definitely stay again on my next visit to San Fran.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed our stay here, the staff were all friendly and helpful, answering any questions we had.
The room was clean and well maintained (as were all the public areas), the large bed was sooo comfortable, bathroom was clean and spacious, plenty of hot water, shower pressure good.
Location was excellent right next to Chinatown, easy walking distance to Union Sq, North Beach and Ferry building (about 20 mins). Plenty of places to eat nearby. Area felt very safe also didn't hear any street noise during the night.
Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Excellent!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is great, especially if you are into the green movement. It is a LEED certified hotel. The location is great - one block from the entrance to Chinatown, two blocks from a cable car stop, and less than ten minutes to walk to a BART station. The food in the restaurant was great also. I highly recommend it!

review.title: Very comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Great location! Helpful staff! Only downside was that you could at times hear people in the neighbouring rooms but nothing that would impact poorly on your stay.

review.title: An ideal place to stay if you want to go visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is just near everything. Baker street is just at 3 blocks and all the museum are around.
Nice people, clean hotel.
If you go by car the park is quite expensive (valet car: 40 U$S/day + tax).

review.title: pleasant place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel honored all of my requests and put me on the highest floor, far from the elevator in a quiet area. The room was small, but very clean and comfortable. The AC worked well and kept the room from becoming stuffy. Although, it is a completely non-smoking hotel, someone in one of the neighboring 2 rooms was smoking and it came under the door into my room. This happened at night, and when I complained to the night clerk at the front desk, he said that he couldn't do anything about it and that the maids would check it out the next day. I had to put a bedspread under the door to keep the smell out. The next morning, the same person was smoking again, so I complained to the morning desk clerk. She immediately sent someone up to the floor to investigate and said that that is what the night clerk should have done too. It is not the hotel's fault that someone was smoking, but I do think that since it is a non-smoking hotel, the night clerk should have been more responsible in seeing that the smoking ceased. In spite of this, I would stay here again. My hotel stay here was much more comfortable and quiet than my previous stay at the SF based chain hotel around the corner that is famous for accepting dogs (which tend to bark all night.)

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean, and the staff was very accomodating. The location was perfect for seeing everything in the area. Great experience!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Excellent location as it is right beside chinatown and many other sites. Many good restaurants within walking distance. Very clean and comfortable room. Valet parking is available at the hotel. Would definitely go back to this hotel.

review.title: LOVED Orchard Garden Hotel
review.reviewText: I booked a room at Orchard Garden Hotel because of the overwhelmingly positive reviews. My experience at the hotel was even better than I expected. The room was clean, light and airy. The bed was fantastically comfortable. The staff was wonderful and attentive to our needs. The location is perfect for all sightseeing. I will MOST DEFINITELY be staying here on my next trip to San Francisco. I seriously can't say enough about this hotel. It's fabulous! :)

review.title: Good Location but a few Drawbacks
review.reviewText:
The location is very good, close to Chinatown, and a short walk from the business district or Union Square. There are lots of fine restaurants and coffee shops nearby.

When we arrived by automobile, there was no place to pull in out of the flow of traffic. We were told to just double park in front of the hotel, which we did while angry people honked horns as we blocked their path.

The hotel seems very new and everything was in excellent condition. However, there were some drawbacks to the room. There was only one chair in the room, forcing my wife or I to read while sitting on the bed. The view out the window was a blank wall. The door on the bathroom was a sliding door that didn't really seal off the bathroom. Except for these drawbacks, the room was fine, but a bit on the cramped side.

Overall, I would rate it above average, but not exceptional.

review.title: A comfortable, well-run hotel.
review.reviewText: We were pleased with all aspects of the Garden Hotel. The front dest staff was attentive and pleasant. Our room was well-appointed. The location was relatively quiet and very convenient.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: It should have said somewhere that there in no parking at the hotel. Two blocks away-$32.00 and across the street $45.00.

review.title: SF weekend
review.reviewText: Good location, professional service, good value.

review.title: Absolutely wonderful hotel, can't wait to go back
review.reviewText:
I had an amazing time in SF and part of that reason was the amazing hotel I stayed at.

Though I know you only stay in the hotel to sleep, it gives such a great feeling after a long day of exploring new city to be someplace that is completely clean, beautifully decorated yet feel completely comfortable.

This is the place. The people at the front desk could not have been more helpful.

review.title: Convenient location, Good service
review.reviewText: Front desk was very accommodating when we first arrived. We drove in from Napa Valley in the morning. Room was not ready for early check in but hotel held on to our luggage until it was. Front desk was very helpful with directions and bus routes around the city. Hotel was VERY clean, and in a great location… right next to the China town gate. Rooms were small, but still comfy… Comfortable bed, nice daylight, desk, tv, mini fridge, small closet, safe, clean bathroom. Great for our weekend stay to finish off our Napa Valley trip. This was a LEED hotel, so definitely a plus for us. Hotel has a roof top area where you can sit and look around the city (just tables and chairs)… not the best view in town, but definitely a nice little feature to look around the city. The French café across the street has AMAZING breakfast! Overall a pleasant experience.

review.title: San Francisco Best Hotel
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, clean, big rooms, very well located right downtown San Francisco, and what a deal!!!

review.title: Very impressed.
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed my stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. So much so, that whilst there I made a further booking!

The hotel is situated close to China Town and Union Square is just down the road. It was clean and very inviting (there's even a roof garden, although I didn't check it out on this occasion).

The room was bigger than I expected and was nice and clean.

What I liked most was the personal touch - they have complimentary DVDs which you can pick up from the reception desk and you can even get FREE access to a computer and printer!

I will definitely book into this hotel again the next time I'm in San Francisco .

review.title: It is an excelent hotel
review.reviewText: It is a very good hotel and I loved it very much. The location is excelent, It's only two blocks of civic center. I liked comfortable rooms, very clean and friendly staff. I recommend this hotel

review.title: Chicago's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel--staff, room, food, service were all great. I will always stay at this hotel when in San Francisco. The front desk went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The room was very appealing and comfortable. Hotel was very convenient to all attractions. The hotel added to an extremely enjoyable trip.

review.title: San Francisco'e best kept secret
review.reviewText:
Great location. Quiet and peaceful until you ready to face San Franciscos great energy Justs steps away to Chinatowns gate and right accross the street is a Starbucks.Sorrounded by great places to eat at anytime, You are treated like a person, not a number.The staff are friendly and helpful. Giving us ideas and directions, Rooms are clean. Beds are so comfortable. Great convinient perk is the computer room complete with 2 computers and a printer. Great for printing boarding passes and checking email. Did not use the fitnees area because walking around town was a workout in itself for me. We cannot wait to come back.
Mahalo

review.title: Great Hotel Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard Garden for eight days and were extremely satisfied. All of the staff members we encountered (front desk, doorman,housekeeping), were very friendly and helpful. Room was nice and clean. No issues with anything in or outside of the room. Parking was expensive but self park was close although expensive as well. Union Square and China Town were only a few steps away. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Modern and affordable
review.reviewText: very nice hotel for the price.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Orchard Garden. A nicely maintained, extremely clean hotel with great service. Very convenient to the Montgomery St. BART station, as well as all of the shops in the downtown/financial district area. Also close to the touristy area of Chinatown. They even upgraded our room to one with a street view. Would highly recommend staying here--it's well worth the money!

review.title: A change of venue that was most welcome...
review.reviewText: See above.

review.title: Excellent hotel for a great price and perfect location
review.reviewText:
I have 3yr old son we came for 5 days. We loved this hotel. The locations was close to everything, very clean.
Its a little small but we didn't spend much time there anyway....

review.title: unique experience
review.reviewText: It was a nice little four story hotel, a "Green" hotel. right by china town. clean and affordable. No parking so the Valet is your main other option. it is not easy to park the car by the valet but I guess that's what life in SF is. Over all we liked it and if you go back probably will chose it again.

review.title: A real find
review.reviewText: this hotel is tucked into the corner of Grant and Kearny, where Chinatown meets the Union Square tourist zone, and just a block from the Financial District. We took BART from the airport and walked about 3 blocks; it was very easy and cheap. The hotel was very nice.

review.title: clean, central, new
review.reviewText:
The hotel lobby was clean and new, the room was spotless, the bathroom shone. There was a lot of outside noise on the first night of my stay-- it was St Patrick's Day and across the street is an Irish bar which held an outdoor party. The noise cut off abruptly at 11 pm, though. I ended up staying an extra night instead of staying with friends as planned because I was so pleased with the room and the hotel's central location.

It does puzzle me that "green" hotels like The Orchard Garden still give away small travel samples of toiletries. I'd have expected them to have high-quality and high-volume dispensers of such things in the shower, so as not to waste so much plastic.

review.title: This hotel is great!
review.reviewText: This was an absolute gem of a hotel. We found it online, it had great reviews, and I have nothing but good things to say about it. It is fairly new, so everything was clean and in order. The hotel service was excellent ant the location was amazing - great restaurants about 2 blocks away.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: perfect stay

review.title: Great location, great hotel
review.reviewText:
We arrived at the hotel a few hours early and were greeted by a very pleasant, smiling receptionist. We asked if it was possible to check in early and although our allocated room was not ready we we were able to take another room instead and check straight in.

I loved the newness and cleanliness of both the common areas and the room. The room was not huge but was large enough for 2 people. The bed was very comfortable and plenty of pillows. The furnishings were very new and clean. I liked the flatscreen tv and the fact that there was a dvd player in the room. We borrowed a movie from reception to watch. There was a coffee machine in the room but I didn't like the taste of the coffee but then I find this in all hotel rooms!! The bathroom was very nice and spacious with a good, hot shower and lovely organic toiletries provided. It was nice to have a modern A/C in the room and we could set the tempurature to what we wanted. There was a large safe in the room as well which was a good extra and oversized robes which were nice to relax in.

This hotel is in an excellent location, right next to the gateway to Chinatown, making exploring San Francisco very easy. The neighbourhood felt safe also unlike other hotels that we have stayed in! We would use this hotel again for our next visit and recommend it to others.

review.title: Orchard Garden Hotle
review.reviewText: I used to live in SF, but now when i come here to work I either couch surf at friends or stay at hotels. i had read about this hotel and the rate was great so i tried it out. i will definitely be back. good central location and a quiet comfortable room. not much else to ask for.

review.title: great location and reasonable prices.
review.reviewText: I stayed during a business trip and would definitely stay again.

review.title: Will go back.
review.reviewText: My room on the first day was stained with tar. Construction in the neighbourhood. I was given another room which is very nice. However, both my room and my children's rooms are without fridges.

review.title: SF's best small hotel
review.reviewText: The loaction's perfect, the staff's decent, the room's cozy and the bathroom's commodious, besides, you got flat tv with no many channels and a leaking shower nozzle, so, do check your shower nozzle before stay in.

review.title: Awesome service
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and exactly what we were looking for. Simple, clean, eco-friendly, and great location. It was a refreshing experience for our weekend in San fran.

review.title: Great hotel. Poor hotel restaurant "Roots".
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent. Staff were very helpful and friendly. However, the hotel restaurant was terrible. That included the appearence, food and service. Roots is a restaurant to miss.

review.title: "Green" hotel, good SF location.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very clean, staff personable. I have stayed several times and everyone has been helpful. On my last visit, there was no one tending the bar and after 10 minutes I asked the front desk to get someone, which they did. The bartender then proceeded to tell me that he had added some "drink specialities"., and this was the first day of the offering, but when I ordered one, he didn't have the ingredients.
Overall, pleasant stay. Rooms are not huge.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Only a few doors down from the gates of Chinatown. Easy walk to Union Square.

review.title: Orchard Garden is a Winner
review.reviewText:
Great location for adventurous walking types, either for very close Chinatown, a nice afternoon walk tour through North Beach and up Telegraph Hill to Coit.
Have stayed in many SF Bay area hotels,..consider this one of the better values. If you come up with an Expedia discounted rate on Orchard Garden, take it without hesitation. The "green" the hotel makes it nice for the environmentally concious.

review.title: Great Hotel for Chinatown Fans
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the best I've ever stayed in. The service was outstanding. The ammenities were exemplary. The location was just 20 steps to the gates of Chinatown. This was a great hotel.

review.title: Wish I had stayed longer!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. It was incredibly clean and beautifully decorated. Great location as well!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful and the customer service outstanding. Perfect location. Would definately go back, but only on the weekday, weekend rates where way over-priced but then all the hotels on the weekend in SF are.

review.title: Green means Go!
review.reviewText: I was incredibly impressed by the quality of Orchard Garden. As it was one of the first Green/Sustainable hotels, I wasn't sure what to expect. The key activated lights & air conditioning was a nice addition that impressed me (and upset my plus one when I would pull the key out as he was in the shower... it was all good fun). I was promised slippers and there weren't any in my room. The mini-fridge was also out of order. Aside from that, it was a great stay. I LOVED the bathroom!!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a small boutiqe hotel with easy access to most major attractions. The room was nicely furnished and clean though a bit on the small side. Staff was very attentive.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a gorgeous oasis situated next to China Town. The hotel is clean, the rooms spotless, and the staff was helpful and very nice. The bed was my favorite item in the hotel. It was beyond comfortable.

review.title: Green Hotel
review.reviewText: Very centrally located, good service. Note our rate did not include contental breakfast and needed to pay extra. However recommend the Bistro across the street for breakfast.

review.title: Perfect place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 (Mum, Dad, 19 yr old & 16 yr old) loved this hotel. We stayed for 9 nights in August. Rooms were quiet, clean & comfortable (beds really good). Ate breakfast and evening meal a couple of times - excellent food, albeit a little slow at breakfast. Staff ALL really welcoming. Art, on the front desk, was a particular gem, nothing we asked was too much trouble and he went out of his way to look after us and recommend places to visit. Excellent location just yards from Chinatown Gate - we walked a lot but also used bus, tram, trolley, cable car - had to queue for cable cars, but an experience not to be missed. Would certainly recommend this hotel - wish I was there now!

review.title: Good choice for the value
review.reviewText: for the summer rate value and location to Union Square area, this was a very good choice. The hotel is not large, but very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden Hotel is right next to the Chinatown Gates and within walking distance to Union Square and Embarcadero. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful and the free wireless works well. The beds are very comfortable. On the downside, the rooms are a bit on the small side and the room service menu doesn't offer many options. Overall a great hotel.

review.title: Mixed Feelings
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden Hotel is in a convenient location if you want to spend time in Chinatown or the Financial District. Other than that, the location isn't convenient. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and it was very good. There aren't any other good restaurant options nearby. The hotel and room were extremely clean and quiet. Housekeeping was great. The bed was hard as a rock though. We got different stories from the front desk about the possibility of a late check out and never received a promised call to straighten the story out. Our experience was okay, but we will stay elsewhere next time.

review.title: Green is good
review.reviewText: Hotel is known for being the first "green hotel" and it lives up to its name. everything about the hotel was energy efficiency. the rooms were spacious and clean, beds were comfortable.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Comfortable, great beds, clean, excellent location, excellent value for money.

review.title: Will definitely stay in this hotel if ever back in San Francisco
review.reviewText: All staff accommodating and courteous.

review.title: San Fran boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The location is great, economy stimulus pricing is right, and staff are helpful and friendly. I never have a problem with the wi-fi and the rooms are comfy, clean, and newly renovated. For business travelers like myself, I wish they had a better general lounge area to kill time/get work done post-checkout/pre-flight. They do have a small business center but it is basically a closet. On several stays they have been very friendly and accomodating letting me work in a tucked away table in the restaurant.

review.title: Would definitely stay again!!
review.reviewText: We went there for a short getaway and what a great discovery this hotel was. It is convenient to Union Square, the Emarcadero, Chinatown, Nob Hill and other areas. We never touched a car during our entire stay, you can walk everywhere. The Hotel is very clean and modern. It has a small bar/restaurant in the lobby which I can't comment on since we never used it. The rooms are a little on the smallish side, think european. Our room had a flat panel tv, dvd player, Ipod docking station on the clock radio. The bed matress may be the most comfortable we have ever slept on. It was fantastic!!! The bathroom was actually on the large side for a hotel. There was enough room for two people to get in there to play with hair, shave, etc. The roof has a small terrace with tables and chairs where you can relax with coffee or a cocktail and enjoy the surrounding skyline. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Valet parking was $40/day so you may want to shop the surrounding garages for cheaper parking. We will definitely be back to the Orchard Garden Hotel!!

review.title: I want to buy the bed!
review.reviewText: Definitely the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in--I am actually looking into purchasing one (there is info. in the room). The hotel was extremely clean and everyone was very helpful. Found out about a day-of-show half-price theater ticket place, got good directions and they put up with all our stupid questions! The hotel is in a great location-close to trolley and can walk most places. We took BART from the airport for cheap and it was just a few blocks walk from Union Square. Try the Irish pub across the street (very quick service and a local hang-out). Also Uncle Vito's pizza just down Bush. We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice quiet place
review.reviewText: Room was on the small side, but nothing to fault in terms of cleanliness, function or comfort. Breakfast a bit minimal. Staff all very friendly. Pretty quiet compared to other SF hotels I've stayed in. (It's listed as "Union Square" but is actually up two blocks and round a corner from the square itself.)

review.title: Perfect place to say in SF
review.reviewText: Perfectly situated, on the edge of Chinatown, convenient to downtown, transit. Rooms are clean, staff is hip and helpful.

review.title: Fantastic !
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great location for sightseeing and shopping. Walking distance to most areas, but also very easy to use public transportation. Staff was more than willing to help out with cabs, rentals and any other inquiries we had. I would return tomorrow without hesitation. The most quiet, comfortable room I've ever stayed in.

review.title: nice and efficient
review.reviewText: very well located, new and clean, with attention to green thinking. I had a room on the 10th floor, quiet and peaceful, with all the comfort and privacy I wanted. I walked 10min. to Moscone Center and on my way back I was able to go through the shopping district without wasting any time with transportation. Lots of restaurants in the area, and since it is in the French district you may try the ones across the street form the Hotel-excelent!

review.title: Great hotel for my first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We really liked the Orchard Garden Hotel. The room was a little smaller than I'm used to, but it sounds like that's pretty common for San Francisco hotels. The bed was really comfortable, and everything was very clean and in good condition. We didn't order room service or eat at the hotel restaurant, so I can't comment on that, but the hotel employees were very helpful and nice. The check-in and check-out processes were a breeze. The location of the Orchard Garden was great! It was so easy to walk to the bus stop or BART. The hotel is on the same block as the Chinatown Gate, so you have immediate access to Chinatown. The major shopping areas of Union Square are a couple of blocks away. We even walked to North Beach from the hotel. In summary, we had a very comfortable stay at the Orchard Garden. I definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Perfectly green experience!
review.reviewText: Great location and over the top amenities at this new SF hotel. Rooms were spacious and meticulous; staff endlessly helpful and gracious. I'd go back tomorrow and next week as well.

review.title: Very good hotel in good location
review.reviewText: We were two women traveling together. We found the hotel to be extremely comfortable and in a very convenient location for getting around the city. There were two minor problems with our room (a leaky shower faucet and a fridge that wouldn't open), and both were fixed promptly once we notified staff. Beds were extremely comfortable. We also felt very safe in the neighborhood, even returning to the hotel after dark.

review.title: highly recommended
review.reviewText: Very beautiful hotel, fantastic comfortable bed, great bathroom. The staff very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast and cocktail menu at the bar brilliant!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was very comfortable and easy walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square. If you plan to valet park your car, make sure you give to plenty of time (up to 15 min) to retrieve it.

review.title: Would visit again
review.reviewText: -Great location -The garden deck view is fantastic -My room did not have a view at all because it was a "3rd party room." But it was nice nonetheless. -Good value for money

review.title: Just a Superb Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel is extremely well located. Of course is not the only one in the area but this one was a good deal. The room is good enough for a short stay but the hotel service quality is really poor.

review.title: Perfect Location...Perfectly Clean & Green!
review.reviewText: This may very well be one of my favorite (reasonably priced) hotels I have ever stayed at. I love the fact that it's green and conscientious of the impact on the environment. It is also super clean here...I personally cannot stand any dingy or dirty crevices and my hotel room was spotless. The rooms can be a little small...the space between the desk and the bed was very narrow but we didn't need a large space. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever had in a hotel - every time you lay down, it puts you to sleep. I like the fact that there was an ipod alarm clock that also charges and the room key controls the power in the room (so you do not waste electricity while out). The location is great...two streets away from Powell (with all the cable cars), 3-4 blocks from Union Square, next door to Chinatown and the BART is about 3-4 blocks away too.
