There's lots of small places to eat at within 1-2 blocks including chain restaurants for picky eaters and ethnic restaurants for the adventurous.

review.title: Great room, great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel and at reasonable price! Chinatown is literally steps away and you can go to Union Square in less than five minutes. The room, having a sofa and a table, is clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This is one of the best located hotels in San Francisco in terms of easy access to everything in town. Plenty of good restaurants nearby as well as transportation and shopping. Not luxurious on amenities but a good value and very comfortable.

review.title: an oasis in the San Francisco desert
review.reviewText: Check in was smooth and painless.Concierge was more than helpful with all our queries.Room was clesn and fresh smelling-only thing was that our view was of the neighbouring rooftops!!Lovely rooftop garden.Ideal location.In short,a memorable stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was great the rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly.

review.title: would return
review.reviewText: newly renovated, clean, quiet. At the end of the stay there was much confusion with the bill (wrong bill given, not up to date). Not a great view. But overall, a great place to stay.

review.title: Great Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: First time staying at this hotel and it definitely lived up to expectations. We were upgraded to a room with a view which put our room facing Bush and didn't notice any noise. Great walking distance to BART and MUNI services. Staff was very helpful. Definitely will stay here again!! We got room service one night from the Roots restaurant, and it was very good.

review.title: Would book again
review.reviewText: Central location handy for everything including BART from airport, short walk from Ferry building and its restaurants. Helpful & friendly staff, comfortable room.

review.title: Best sleep ever!
review.reviewText: I do not usually sleep well in hotels and even though the time difference wreaked havoc on my sleep patterns, I slept great in this hotel! The mattress is magical. The service was also exceptional. I was in town for a conference and I arrived way before regular check-in time, about 5 hours before check-in but they had me in a room as soon as I got there. I expected that I would just have to store my luggage and wander around for hours. The staff is warm and helpful and, while small, the room is comfortable, clean, and green! The location is perfect, just a couple blocks from union square and I even walked to fisherman's wharf from the hotel (mind you this is a much longer uphill walk). I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and again.

review.title: Clean but small
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and contemporary. the service was reasonable, the charge for parking and internet was exuberant and unnecessarily high!!

review.title: Comfy, convenient and environmentally rock on!
review.reviewText: Superb hotel - great location in downtown San Francisco with friendly staff, extremely comfortable and clean rooms, and a wealth of bonus features! Front desk will lend you DVDs for your room at no cost and the environmental credentials of the hotel are top notch - recycling bins in rooms, recycled paper products, major energy efficiency, water efficiency initiatives, local products, soy-based inks... they have it all going on. So have a comfy, friendly, secure and convenient stay and do a little bit extra for the planet at the same time. Great!

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to everything, great staff, cool ECO rooms and good smelling shampoo. :). I will be back. I have stayed at about 10 hotels in Downtown San Fran in the past 2 years and this one takes the cake.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: Would definitely go back...staff and hotel were wonderful!

review.title: A great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay at this place. All the basics were right - friendly and prompt service, good sized room with a large and bright bathroom, all the amenities you'd expect. Free internet access in the small business centre was a bonus, most other places I've stayed charge for using their PCs, the 'free' internet access only applying if you've got your own laptop, which I didn't have. One of the best things about the Orchard Garden is its location, a couple of minutes walk from Union Square, two blocks from the BART / Muni at Montgomery, and on Chinatown's doorstep. Lots of good bars / cafes also within a few yards of the hotel. If you prefer to stay within its walls, the food in the hotel's own restaurant was great too! Recommended.

review.title: Great Green Hotel
review.reviewText: New & clean, environmentally-friendly building with elegant modern decor, super central convenient location and friendly, accommodating staff. Beds nice, clean and hypoallergenic, but not super cushiony. Rooms on the smaller side, but fine for sleeping. Did not like the complimentary toiletries at all. No chemical air fresheners or smelly cleaners is a huge plus! Restaurant is lovely & the dinner cuisine served is a creative culinary gourmet treat using local & organic ingredients -- excellent food & cocktails & service! Vegetarians can also eat well here. Not inexpensive, but highly recommended & worth the price for the quality meal & gracious & professional servers.

review.title: Excellent accomidations!!
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect, even down to the valet parking. Walking distance to Union Square, restaurants, and the terrace was beautiful on the 10th floor. I will make sure to book this hotel for future visits.

review.title: Totally positive experience
review.reviewText: Stayed on top floor. Great bed. Super reading lights next to bed. Quiet. Bathroom sliding door was a cinch. Front desk helpful, pleasant, and answered all my questions. Great location. Weather in SF was unusually warm for January and I even missed two snowstorms at home. Now the best part. This is a "GREEN" hotel. No scents, no environmentally harsh chemicals. Baskets were set up to sort trash in if I desired (which I did). I slept like a dream and felt great.

review.title: Excellent hotel in san francisco
review.reviewText: Not your typical boutique hotel, orchard hotels are wonderful places to stay, just north of union square. I stay at orchard hotels about 40 nights a year and service, rooms, everything is excellent. The garden hotel here is new, all green, and beautiful.

review.title: Nice room but don't bring a car
review.reviewText: My wife and I steyed recently for a night at the Orchard Garden Hotel. The hotel is in a great section of the city adjacent to Chinatown (right next to the Grant St. gate), and the Expedia promotional rate made it quite a deal. The hotel is very nice, in a small sort of way; elegant yet understated. The room was very small, buy well laid out and clean. My only complaint is in regards to parking - the valet service was terrible. We typically had to wait twenty minutes for our car to be retrieved, and dropping it off at the door was often problematic. If you plan to stay ay this hotel, my advice is to either forgo a car altogether or plan to use public transportation.

review.title: Sleep well in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I don't usually sleep well in a hotel when I travel. The Orchard Garden in the exception. Beautiful, comfortable bed, high thread count sheet crisp white sheets and a mountain of fluffy pillow. All encased in a lovely, moderen eco-friendly room. The staff at the hotel is wonderful too. Real attention to customer service.

review.title: Great deal in S.F.
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a great place to stay in S.F. Centrally located to transportation: Muni/Bart are only 3 blocks away; buses are 2-3 blocks away; cable car is 3 blocks away; and a rental car agency is only 3-4 blocks away. Close to activities: Ferry Building and the Farmer's Market; Union Square; Chinatown; and North Beach. Staff were very pleasant and the room was clean and comfortable. A great value when we booked along with airfare (free wifi was great but a little slow). A stay here will not disappoint.

review.title: Total Surprise
review.reviewText: This hotel was all that the earliest review had said. Chinatown entrance is right up the street,(one business away)walking distance to Union Square. Staff was very pleasant. Rooms very comfortable, love the decor, great ideas for my own home. Highly recommend!

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: OK hotel, everything is new, and the bath products are good. Mattresses are not very comfortable, rooms are small, and have a view of other buildings. Water pressure is low. Also it is a very touristy area, at least five hotels in the same block, and it shuts down after seven, so it is quite difficult to find places to eat other than the hotel's restaurant.

review.title: Good for Business Travelers
review.reviewText: This hotel is good for business travelers, because it has ample parking across the street and is close to downtown. The hotel has a very small fitness room and limited views out of the room windows. The roof terrace is nice, but nothing out of the ordinary for a city hotel. The food is adequate, but overpriced. I would not choose to stay here if I had not been on business. The room is not large enough for more than 1 person.

review.title: Will book in on next visit to SF
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel, staff were excellent, nothing was too much trouble. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel - great location
review.reviewText: Located almost next door to the Chinatown Gates. Very pleasant hotel, immaculate bathroom, comfy bed, quiet (and our room was directly across from elevator). Adequate sized room (we had the king size bed (no view) but according to the floor plan the rooms facing the street were half our size. Right across from a nice french bistro Cafe de la Presse. Enjoyable weekend stay. Suggest that you do not park with the hotel - we parked at the Sutter Street garage and it was half the price. The garage exit was an easy block away.

review.title: Sparkling Clean Hotel in Super Location
review.reviewText: A friend and I wanted to get away over the New Year's weekend and booked the Orchard Garden online for a great rate. It ended up being better than we imagined. Nice, helpful staff, great SF location for seeing the town (near Chinatown gate, Union Square, Ferry Building, Market, etc. etc.)and clean, comfortable rooms. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Quality Hotel at an affordable price
review.reviewText: The Hotel is central to all of your needs, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach etc and is clean, the staff are very friendly and the rate is competitive. We absolutely enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great location and good value
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable hotel in an exellent location close a short distance from Union Square and right by the entrance to Chinatown. Good value San Francisco hotel.

review.title: I've never been in such an odor-neutral (VOC) hotel room...wonderful.
review.reviewText: I deliberately chose this hotel because of its headline as a LEEDS compliant, eco-friendly hotel. I'm no expert, but my expectations in this regard were completely met. I would definitely stay here again. The front desk and other staff were consistently gracious and helpful. The relatively central (downtown) location was great. The only minor ding was the inattention to the obvious remnants of lipstick on one drinking glass...on balance, just barely worth mentioning at all.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Extremely satisfied with this hotel. It is centrally located, ideal for Union Square and within easy reach of all the other attractions of San Francisco as all forms of transport are within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We found the hotel to be quiet, without any street noise disturbing our sleep and the staff were very helpful. Rooms were very clean, bright and spacious, with good temperature control. All in all, well worth the money, this hotel made a great trip even better.

review.title: Great Hotel! Definitely Recommend!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at this hotel. The employees were very friendly and always willing to help us with our many questions! We had never been to San Francisco before so we weren't sure of where anything was or the best way to get around. The Room was very nice and also comfortable! I loved the fact that everything was environmentally friendly too! Great experience! Definitely recommend!

review.title: Quiet , Comfy and Pleasant
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a nice, clean quiet hotel in the midst of the hustle in San Francisco, this is it. Comfortable beds and pillows and a friendly, helpful staff completed a perfect 4 night stay. Will gladly stay again when I visit again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an great location just 50 metres from the China Gate and a short downhill stroll to Market street. The hotel is in excellent condition and room and bathroom are of a reasonable size, clean and well serviced. A NO smoking policy applies. Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable when it came to advice for transport and attractions to visit. Rooftop garden was nice and well maintained with plenty of seating area.Internet access was free. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Convenient and Clean
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great location near Chinatown Gate. It is immaculate and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would recommend it highly and can't wait to go back.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. It is ideally situated near to Union Square and all the Tram routes. Both San Francisco and the hotel were the perfect antidote to our stay in the OTT Las Vegas. I'm no eco-warrior but am in total agreement with the hotels request not to change the bedding during our short stay. And well done for including recycling bins. I'm glad to see the Gideon bible won't be going to landfill. Take the BART from the airport to the Montgomery stop for about $5 (a taxi will cost you $30+) and take a 5 min walk to the hotel. Invest in a MUNI passport for your stay which will get you free access to all public transport, apart from the BART. It will save you money but more importantly you won't have to go through the embarrassment of finding the right change each time you get on.

review.title: Great location; modern and friendly
review.reviewText: The hotel is a 'green' hotel - but don't worry, it still has all the luxuries you would expect from a great hotel (inc. Aveda toiletries)! The rooms are modern, bright and housekeeping offered turndown every evening. The rooms are imaculately clean and the reception staff are extremely helpful - happy to give out free maps and cicle points of interest and give you bus/tram numbers to attractions. (They found out the exact location for us to return our rental car to and put it on a map!) The location is great right by China town gate - a 5-10 minute stroll to Union Square (shops); Chinatown (cultural/restaurants) and North Beach (great bars; Italian restaurants) and a quick tram ride up to Fisherman's Wharf. We felt very safe walking back to the hotel late in the evening. There are no bars/clubs right by - it is about a 10 min walk but we thought that was good!

review.title: Our stay.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, next to Chinatown and not far from Union Square. Easy to walk down to bay, two blocks from California Street cablecar to/from Ferry Building. Staff friendly and helpful. We bought 3 day Muni passes so transport around town was easy. Didn't eat at the hotel...breakfast a bit pricey for a holiday trip. Readily found alternatives nearby.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice size, in a good location. The only thing that really lets it down is the buffet breakfast which is not very good. However in San Francisco there are plenty of other places to go to get a great breakfast!

review.title: Great Green Get Away
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. Beautiful, comfortable, with all the luxuries you are accustomed to in high quality hotels with the added bonus of being eco-friendly. The location is fantastic, literally right next to the China Town Gates and union square shopping with easy access to multiple public transportation routes.

review.title: Great place.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and cheerful, and the location great with access to Chinatown, BART and Muni. Financial District and Downtown Area within short walking distance. Terrific place to stay.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel for 4 nights and we were highly satisfied. It's near to union square and china town and not far from the cable car. The staff were very friendly and helpful with directions etc. It was clean, very comfortable and quiet, just what you need after a hard days sightseeing/shopping!

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, nice front desk people... very satisfied with stay

review.title: Inviting hotel, wonderful experiece
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel very much. We found the staff very informative and helpful with directions. Our room was very clean and a very comfortable bed.The hotel was within walking distance to everything, which was wonderful because we didn't have a car rental.The only two negative commments would be there is no mini fridge in the room and there is no vending soda machines in the hotel.We would stay in this hotel again. Great value!

review.title: Friendly helpfull staff, eager to help.........great beds.......and the robes-slippers ,ahhhhh
review.reviewText: THE STAFF WERE FANTASTIC, KIND AND OVER ALL WE COULDNT HAVE CHOSEN A BETTER HOTEL, WE DIDNT EAT AT THE HOTEL(HAPY HOUR ONCE) SO WE CANT RECCOMEND THE RESTARAUNT BUT THE PARMESIAN FRIES FOR HAPPY HOUR WERE FANTASTIC,THIS HOTEL WAS THE CENTRE FOR EVERYTHING AND WE WALKED THIS CITY TOP TO BOTTOM AND LOCATION WAS KEY.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Lovely Hotel, very impressed by the cleanliness. The hotel staff were pleasant and friendly and helpfull with enquires. The hotel is central to market street, were all the main shops are, Maceys etc. We like walking so it took us about 40mins to walk to pier 33, you see so much of the city when you do this although you need to be realivey fit as there are a lot of hills. The room was fabulous, very peacefull even though you are in the center of the city. It was spacious and made more comfortable with little touchs like lovely soft dressing gowns. It was also quite a nice sized room and if you intend to watch much tv this was a state of the art modern plasma. I would definatelty stay here again. We didnt try out the restaurant but it was busy most evenings

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I and my daughter like this hotel very much and would like to stay there if we visit SF again.

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great location right next to the China town gates - clean new and comfortable hotel located just near a stop for the Greyline open top hop on hop off tourist bus.

review.title: Great small hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights in the Orchard Garden Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean, quiet and comfortable. We travel a lot and tend to prefer small boutique hotels and the Orchard Garden did not disappoint. It is steps from the Chinatown Gate and a nice walk through the financial district to the Ferry Building area. The only fault I could find with the hotel is that there was no chair in the room, so reading or watching tv had to be done from the bed! There was no view from our room, but we spent most of our time walking around the city rather than looking at it from our window. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, comfortable base for sightseeing.

review.title: Fantastic hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel the first week of August. It is just steps from the Chinatown Gate and close to Union Square, Nob Hill, and the Financial District. Away from the crowds of tourists, but accessible to popular neighborhoods and transportation. Desk staff was awesome, very clean and comfortable rooms, and its a certified green hotel. Only complaint is the expense of the restaurant and mini bar items. Stay here, you won't regret it.

review.title: Great Green Getaway
review.reviewText: My wife and I only stayed at the Orchard Garden for 1 night, but the we really liked it, so we will be back. The room was extremely comfortable, and the hotel is situated in a great neighborhood just off Union Square.

review.title: A room with a view would make this the perfect place
review.reviewText: The rooms are well appointed and are clean, although I'd specify a room with a view if we returned as ours looked onto a brick wall. That aside, there was little to take away from what was a fantastic stay. The staff in particular made us feel very welcome.

review.title: Best green hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: Absolutely wonderful experience. Everything was top notch. The only one, tiny down-side was the resteraunt. The food was fantastic but over-priced. Everything else was completely first rate!

review.title: Very nice and convenient
review.reviewText: If you want to stay in the city, this is a great place. Rooms are tight like most city hotels but very clean and modern. We like to be able to walk everywhere and experience the city at night and this was perfect. If you have a car, the valet parking is convenient and about the going rate ($38 a day.)

review.title: Understated elegance
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a wonderful three-night stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel in San Francisco. Located on the fringe of Chinatown, the Orchard Garden reflects Asian influence in decor, service, and understated elegance. The room was pleasant and comfortable, and simply furnished with a king size bed and a small sofa in the sitting area. (No art on the walls, perhaps a reflection of the area's earthquake vulnerability.) A wooden sliding door on the bathroom took some getting used to. We did not dine at the hotel's Roots restaurant, but we received some terrific dining recommendations from the hotel concierge, all within walking distance. There are at least 5 Starbucks within walking distance, too, but the hotel has free coffee and fresh fruit in the lobby. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, providing the aforementioned dining tips, hailing cabs, mapping routes, and providing access to the business center. (Two computers with free wireless internet access.) Though the hotel seems to cater to business travelers, the hotel staff made tourists feel equally welcome. I highly recommend the Orchard Garden.

review.title: A new and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly and accomodating. Hotel is conveniently located. Rooms are very comfortable and have a flat screen TV, free internet. Small but nice exercise room. Restaurant has nice menu and great food. We love everything about this hotel and it's nice that it is a "green" hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was great, the bed was comfortable and the staff was very helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Very Clean and Quiet...Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with how clean the room was...I even take a black light to check for cleanliness and they passed with flying colors. Staff was friendly and I was very pleased.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. People were very nice and helpful.

review.title: The Best of the Best
review.reviewText: New, clean, quiet! Great location. I mean really, do you need to know anything else except that it's a "Green Hotel". A beautiful place to stay that was made earth friendly.

review.title: Great find in that area of town.
review.reviewText: Got upgraded to the junior suite. However, there was nothing "junior" about it.

review.title: Great hotel for the deal
review.reviewText: We had never stayed in SF, and thought this hotel was a great deal for our first stay. It was conveniently located. We walked to the SFMOMA, Union Square shopping, Chinatown, etc. I had read in other reviews that the room was small, and it definitely was smaller than expected. The bathroom was quite unnecessarily large, and I think they should have added that extra square footage to the room. The bathroom door slides closed, but doesn't close all of the way. If you are at all embarrassed by someone overhearing your bathroom business, this might not be ideal. I also had read that the hotel offers Aveda products, but this is not the case (at least not in the room where we stayed). The room service menu is quite lacking which is a downfall because the Financial District (where this is located) doesn't exactly offer a sit down breakfast. Expect to pay quite a bit for just toast and coffee. The valet parking was 4 bucks more than listed on the website, but I now wish we had done it since this really is the going rate in town. Overall, the hotel was good. It was quiet, clean and simple enough for our needs. I wouldn't recommend this for families, but might be great for a business traveler or a couples' weekend getaway.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Fairly new hotel just on the edge of downtown financial area next door to the Chinatown Gate. This proved to be an ideal place to be based to explore the city. The hotel is modern,clean,bright & very comfortable. The staff are all friendly & very helpful. Restaurant is a huge bonus as food is very good & well priced. Would not hesitate to stay again as The Orchard Garden was also excellent value. Would recommend wholeheartedly.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: Great location. Very clean.

review.title: Honeymoon Vacay
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel for 6 nights. We were very impressed with the quality of the hotel. It was comfy, romantic, and the beds are extremely comfortable! If your taking a a quick jaunt into the city I would def. recommend this hotel, however for long stays such as ours, it was a little tiresome. It is right in the heart of the financial district which is wonderful during the day, but at night it stays pretty dead in that area. It is difficult to get food past 10:00pm, but for early romantic one-of-a-kind dinners, it's the spot! I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My criteria for a good hotel, in order, is: 1. Is it clean? 2. Does it attract a quiet sort of fellow traveler? 3. Is it affordable? 4. Does the staff practice decent customer service? By these standards, the Orchard Garden is a great hotel. Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. We had a room near the housekeeping closet, and although we could hear the staff talking as they were working, the noise was not intrusive. The other guests did not seem rowdy or loud in their rooms or in the halls. The hotel was quite affordable since we got a great price (by San Francisco standards) through Expedia. The front desk staff seemed pleasant and helpful enough. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. The only caution I would mention to people considering this hotel applies to those with mobility issues. The door to our bathroom was a heavy, wooden sliding panel. It looked great, but if you have any motion or strength restrictions (as one of us did on this trip--an injured shoulder), this chic feature becomes a bit of a pain to operate. Even this should not dissuade you from staying at the Orchard Garden. I mention it only for information. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Loved our Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect. Very friendly staff. Easy check in. Very clean room. Comfortable bed and a huge bathroom. The room was actually bigger than I was expecting. What I though was particularly nice is the bathroom was handicap equipped. It had a huge tub/shower with handicap rails and a shower seat. Not something you see in most hotels. The extra touches were nice such as morning paper and turn down service. It was our home away from home.

review.title: Sleep well at night
review.reviewText: Great location. The room was quiet, modern, spotless and in perfect working condition (the shower was awesome!) Plamsa tv, iPod dock were nice touches. Added to that was the "green" factor - it's why we decided to try the hotel in the first place. Good value, super-comfy and environmentally with it? No wonder I slept so well at night!

review.title: Next to Chinatown
review.reviewText: This was a great change of scenery from our Fisherman's Wharf hotel - just a few steps away from Dragon's Gate and the entrance to Chinatown.

review.title: Chic & convenient
review.reviewText: We selected the Orchard Garden for its eco-friendliness but were as impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the great location -- walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach. Would definitely return!

review.title: Great Vacation!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, room really clean, perfect room for couples.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very nice hotel. Service was very good and efficient. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely return.

review.title: Nice and pleasant
review.reviewText: Great location, exellent staff, nice and comfortable rooms. Will came back soon.

review.title: Happy with the Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was as it looked on Expedia's website, which was a great thing. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful with whatever we needed (more towels, directions, a taxi, etc).

review.title: liked the effort to be green.
review.reviewText: view out windows not the best but ok.

review.title: One of San Francisco's Finest!
review.reviewText: Exceptional hotel with exceptional staff. We had a room with two double beds. It was nicely appointed but a little too small for the price. The larger suite-type rooms were fabulous with balconies that over-looked the city. The roof-top garden was a great place to be day or night. The lobby bar had great bartenders and fabulous appetizers at happy hour. The location is the best with access by taxi or foot to just about anywhere in the downtown area and Chinatown. We would not hesitate to return.

review.title: Clean but expensive,
review.reviewText: rooms small,elevator out of order. Convenient to business district,Chinatown, bus lines and BART. Probably will not return.

review.title: Great San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: This was our first time at the Orchard Garden and we loved it. Very clean and crisp decor, professional and friendly staff. The room was a nice size, and we loved that it was a 'green' hotel. It was in a great location, close to everything but still just slightly off the beaten path, so you aren't too overwhelemed with tourist crowds, etc. The only complaint we had is that one of the hotel's elevators was out of service (they only have 2 elevators total), so we literally waited 20 minutes sometimes to get to the elevator, and there were lots of crowds around it. Besides that it was great, and we'd definitely go back and stay there!

review.title: Nice but Service Kinks
review.reviewText: Good location, nice room and happy to see the LEED certification. Perhaps early service kinks but non working elevator for entire stay, closed roof deck, non working espresso bar, missing bellman and no record of "breakfast included" rate was frustrating.

review.title: San Francisco's best green hotel
review.reviewText: This trip was my honeymoon and my wife and I really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was one of the best that I've stayed in San Francisco. The location is unbeatable ( right at the base of Chinatown and two blocks away from Union Square). The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The all organic continental breakfast was also very nice. Even though we had a room on the street side, we had no problem with the noise. We didn't get to sample the dinner menu, but the aroma was very nice every evening (can not wait to try their restaurant next time). Overall, this hotel is highly recommended.

review.title: Superb Location, excellent staff, lovely rooms
review.reviewText: The Orchard Garden is literally on the steps of Chinatown, which makes it an ideal location for exploring the city. Union square is a 5 minute walk and the trams to Fishermans Wharf are only 2 blocks away. The rooms are a good size and the beds are fantastic. Everything spotlessly clean and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly.

review.title: will stay again
review.reviewText: People were very nice. Car rental close by if you needed a car.The only problem we had the restaurants in that area are closed on sat and sun. We have already have our room for next year.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We just spent our honeymoon in San Francisco, staying at the Orchard Garden. We chose this hotel for its location and because it had received very positive reviews. We were not disappointed. We were located at the Chinatown Gate, with easy access to cable cars, restaurants, good shopping etc. The hotel staff were all helpful and pleasant. The room was on the small side, but very comfortable. We found the bed and pillows exceptionally comfortable (and not just because this was our honeymoon!). The continental breakfast provided by the hotel was excellent - croissants, cereal, toast, muffins, scones, cheese, fresh fruit, ham, hard-boiled eggs, juices, coffee, tea. We loved the place and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to others. We're already planning our next visit.

review.title: Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText: I have always know about the Orchard hotel and the New Orchard Garden was a pleasant suprise. Service was great, the little continental breakfast was great, room was nice and clean. I am in San Francisco quite a bit to conduct wine business and this hotel will now be my first choice for business travel as well as travel with my wife. Great deal.

review.title: Very comfortable--great staff!
review.reviewText: Beautiful new hotel on edge of Chinatown. Hotel and rooms smaller than expected. Casual but elegant. Wonderful staff.

review.title: Will definitely go back!
review.reviewText: Couldn't be happier with the service, room rates, ammenities, and location. The ecofriendly aspects were nice also. All the little extras, with its contemporary feel made me feel well cared for. I would be really interested in trying the restaurant on my next visit (and there will definitely be a next).

review.title: Great Choice
review.reviewText: Excellent choice within walking distance of all downtown attractions. Great breakfast buffet and friendly and helpful service.

review.title: I'm looking for a reason to go to SF so I can stay here again!
review.reviewText: The hotel is brand new, so some small kinks to work out, but the hotel staff is really accommodating and friendly. From bellman to waiter, the entire team is animated about making it a wonderful stay. Be sure to have dinner in the restaurant - the cheese plate is exceptional. Could use a few more veg options, but the chef put together something for me on the fly and I loved it. The fitness center is just a treadmill, stepper and bike, but it did keep me from skipping my workout if I'd had to go out in the cold in the morning. A wonderful environmental concept and executed beautifully. Where have you been all my travel life???
